commit_message:
Add generic method for preserving plan files, use for user-environment.yaml

This should keep the existing functionality, but via a method which
could be generically reused for network and roles files too, and maybe
the plan environment file too.

Partial-Bug: #1749700
Change-Id: I4f721b5aa699c6cc23ccb2de8c841caa6b078b30
(cherry picked from commit ba106753ecc3a569bc1c3dbecc34c6f894636ba8)

commit_message:
Ensure ip_forward set before Docker

Docker will attempt to configure iptables rules if it finds that
ip_forward is not enabled prior to the docker daemon getting started.
We should ensure that this gets configured prior to Docker being
configured if we are configuring it with puppet.

Change-Id: I6ea6fb8ed300d284c961e7474ff84d104f326255
Needed-By: I557e4a41c4e5be3a2f50e5d5ddc86e17c1eb44e1
Related-Bug: #1750194
(cherry picked from commit 20cdbd3c6b18bb83e801d4cd7b1d23e38168e055)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 14:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use upper constraints when installing virtualbmc

The lack of UC means that pip is attempting to install libvirt-python
4.1.0, which is failing on Ubuntu due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1753539.

Currently upper-constraints limits libvirt-python to 4.0.0, which does
not have this issue.

Change-Id: I97e055aa1d4ebdd85693eeb8228b58a6bc9bad9a
Related-Bug: #1753539
(cherry picked from commit 28b6b8c96f89532bbddeca513285e6c00db89205)
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper constraints when installing virtualbmc

The lack of UC means that pip is attempting to install libvirt-python
4.1.0, which is failing on Ubuntu due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1753539.

Currently upper-constraints limits libvirt-python to 4.0.0, which does
not have this issue.

Change-Id: I97e055aa1d4ebdd85693eeb8228b58a6bc9bad9a
Related-Bug: #1753539
(cherry picked from commit 28b6b8c96f89532bbddeca513285e6c00db89205)

commit_message:
Allow stacking without creating initial neutron networks

This allows a user to prevent neutron from creating the initial
networks if NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS is set to false. The
initial networks will be created by default.

Closes-Bug: #1699870

Change-Id: I51f0cb9fcf07e776ca750cd7d9e43a369e2f8520

commit_message:
Re-implement more removed novaclient bits

/os-hosts was removed in Compute API 2.43 and from novaclient's
Python API in 10.0.

Not all of the world is so priveleged to be on modern releases.

Change-Id: I6e5af0370439c99ead389247c047f22ba499547e

As far as I'm concerned the code in calculate_virtual_free_capacity is wrong, the calculation of the reserved percentage is incorrect.  It is being calculated from the real capacity and then subtracted from the virtual capacity (overprovisioned).

We should be calculating the reserved from the real total and subtracting it before calculating virtual or applying the over subscription ratio as well.

So I am not in favor of more of our code using the broken calculation."}, {'account_id': 22683, 'date': '2017-07-18 10:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ok, so both calculate_virtual_free_capacity AND the code in question are wrong, is that correct? Do you agree that the calculation in CapacityFilter is wrong too?

We can fix calculate_virtual_capacity too in a different changeset or even add fixing to this changeset. In any case we should fix this code and not leave it like this.

By the way it is not clear if "reserved" should be calculated from total physical or from total virtual. It could be correct if we treat it as "reserved from physical". After all, Cinder doesn't really have a notion of "Virtual capacity", only oversubscription for thin provisioning.

Gorka, PLEASE reply.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-07-18 10:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, I'm not saying that the CapacityFilter calculation is wrong, I'm saying that it follows a different logic from yours (so both are correct).

I have replied to your comment on the bug report, as it seems like a good place to keep the discussion (or we could do it on IRC)."}, {'account_id': 25677, 'date': '2017-07-18 11:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Please take a look of the following patch set which included a lengthy discussion on the exact same line you are trying to change in this patch.  After discussion, we decided it is safer to keep this calculation.  Also we decided not to use utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity() which is used in the weigher.  In weigher, we have to use one formula to come up with a number for ranking.  In filter, there are multiple steps to filter things out.  So they are not exactly the same.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189261/3/cinder/scheduler/filters/capacity_filter.py

After discussion, we agreed just to rename the variable to adjusted_free_virtual:

Maybe this could be a good place to discuss this: https://review.openstack.org/490116'}, {'account_id': 18529, 'date': '2017-09-26 07:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1000GB - 200GB/1.2) * 1.2 = 1000GB = 1200GB - 200GB

800GB * 1.2 = 960GB  is a safe way.'}, {'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2017-09-26 07:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

When executing the concurrency operation of creating volume
in the periodic time of update capability, it happened.

For example:
At the begining, free is 10G, max_over_subscription_ratio is 2,
it means we can create 4*5G. But actually only the first two
volumes can be created.

First volume:   virtual_free = 10*2 = 20 > 5 --> Success. Free = 10 - 5 = 5
Second volume:  virtual_free = 5*2 = 10 > 5 --> Success. Free = 5 - 5 = 0
Third volume:   virtual_free = 0*2 = 0 < 5 --> Failed.
Forth volume:   virtual_free = 0*2 = 0 < 5 --> Failed.'}, {'account_id': 22683, 'date': '2017-09-26 09:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dongdong Pei the current way Cinder uses max_over_subscription_ratio is by multiplying it by the free physical capacity only. So the calculation is (1000GB-200GB) * 1.2 (I'm not sure where your division by 1.2 came from). The result 960GB is incorrect because if you provision and write 200GB from a 1TB physical / 1.2 TB virtual pool, you should have 1TB left to provision. 960GB is a meaningless number in this case.

yenai your use case is exactly what the patch was trying to solve. I was trying to change the calculation from "free virtual = free physical * max_osr" to "free virtual = total physical * max_osr - used virtual" (the calculation in calculate_virtual_free_capacity).I completely agree your use case should work and this patch would have fixed this (third volume: free = 10*2-10=10), but there is strong disagreement about this issue from core maintainers. See related bug I opened for the same use case: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1704786'}, {'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2017-09-26 09:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The CapacityWeigher is the same condition, why not keep the same?'}, {'account_id': 22683, 'date': '2017-09-26 09:48:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Exactly. CapacityWeigher uses calculate_virtual_free_capacity which is the function I wanted to use here. They don't do the same calculations because the developers don't agree with each other (gorka, xing-yang). It's inconsistent and they refuse to fix this (again, see open bug)."}, {'account_id': 18529, 'date': '2017-09-26 14:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

total 1000
osr 2
used = provisoned = 1000

adjust_virtual_capacity = 1000

but free is 0'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-10 00:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 22683, 'date': '2018-03-07 15:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The inconsistency between the two calculation methods has been resolved by spec:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/queens/provisioning-improvements.html
and commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534854/'}]

[{'created': '2017-07-17 12:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Calculate free virtual space correctly in CapacityFilter

adjusted_free_virtual was calculated as
free * max_over_subscription_ratio
but max_over_subscription_ratio deals with the total
capacity and multiplying it with free capacity yields
wrong values
Example: if max_OSR is 1.2 and the physical capacity
is 1 TB, then the virtual capacity is 1.2 TB. If 200 GBs
are then allocated *and written*, then "free" (physical)
will be 800 GB and free virtual will be 1 TB,
but free * osr (800 * 1.2) will be 960 GB - incorrect.
The function caculate_virtual_free_capacity is made
for the correct calculation.

Change-Id: I2e8964918d6c96bd06124df8212c4e0f19ffcfcd
Closes-Bug: 1704786

commit_message:
Calculate free virtual space correctly in CapacityFilter

adjusted_free_virtual was calculated as
free * max_over_subscription_ratio
but max_over_subscription_ratio deals with the total
capacity and multiplying it with free capacity yields
wrong values
Example: if max_OSR is 1.2 and the physical capacity
is 1 TB, then the virtual capacity is 1.2 TB. If 200 GBs
are then allocated *and written*, then "free" (physical)
will be 800 GB and free virtual will be 1 TB,
but free * osr (800 * 1.2) will be 960 GB - incorrect.
The function caculate_virtual_free_capacity is made
for the correct calculation.

Change-Id: I2e8964918d6c96bd06124df8212c4e0f19ffcfcd
Closes-Bug: 1704786

commit_message:
Fix invalid UUIDs in remaining tests

There were many places in various Nova tests that used plain/fake strings where the object was expecting a UUID, which caused lots of warning output when running the tests. This patch replaces these usages with proper UUIDs, as per review comments on related bug 1606647.

Change-Id: I68505fb729fa765c33b8d07352277bdac9626578
Closes-Bug: 1746747
Related-Bug: 1606647

commit_message:
Add a nova-caching-scheduler job to the experimental queue

This adds an experimental queue job to run non-slow tempest
API and scenario tests using the CachingScheduler as the
scheduler driver.

A blacklist is added since there are a few tests that rely on
filters which don't work well with the CachingScheduler.

The CachingScheduler is deprecated, but this is useful to have
when we're making changes to the scheduler or flows within the
code that involve the scheduler, such as the alternate hosts
work.

Change-Id: I8630ea11c3067ed934de2ef27a63432418e98c33

commit_message:
Allow stacking without creating initial neutron networks

This allows a user to prevent neutron from creating the initial
networks if NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS is set to false. The
initial networks will be created by default.

Closes-Bug: #1699870

Change-Id: I51f0cb9fcf07e776ca750cd7d9e43a369e2f8520

commit_message:
Allow stacking without creating initial neutron networks

This allows a user to prevent neutron from creating the initial
networks if NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS is set to false. The
initial networks will be created by default.

Closes-Bug: #1699870

Change-Id: I51f0cb9fcf07e776ca750cd7d9e43a369e2f8520

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 21:38:56.000000000', 'message': 'Save admin password to sysmeta in libvirt driver

We have an API for setting the admin password for an already created
instance and we have a metadata API for retrieving the encrypted
password. In the libvirt driver, when a request to set the admin
password is received, it is indeed set in the guest but the instance
system metadata is never updated with the encrypted password, so
attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc

attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc

commit_message:
Save admin password to sysmeta in libvirt driver

We have an API for setting the admin password for an already created
instance and we have a metadata API for retrieving the encrypted
password. In the libvirt driver, when a request to set the admin
password is received, it is indeed set in the guest but the instance
system metadata is never updated with the encrypted password, so
attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc

commit_message:
Add new Resource Provider functions to placement client

Added list_resource_providers function, which allows to retrieve
a list of Resource Providers filtering by UUID or parent UUID.

Added get_resource_provider function, which allows to retrieve an
specific Resource Provider by its UUID.

This feature depends on Nova Nested Resource Providers.

Depends-On: I4db74e4dc682bc03df6ec94cd1c3a5f5dc927a7bi

Change-Id: I6eb42b9a53c8001c5f14d4d1c9a98e060148ae21
Partial-Bug: #1578989
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>

messages: [{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-03-07 14:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-03-07 14:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\ngit mistake'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 14:30:19.000000000', 'message': 'Transform missing delete notifications

The Iddbe50ce0ad3c14562df800bbc09ec5a7e840485 patch only considered
instance delete in the happy case when the instance is scheduled to a
compute successfully and the compute is available when the delete
action is executed. If the instance is never scheduled to a compute or
the compute is not available when the instance is deleted legacy delete
notifications are emitted from different places, compute.api instead of
compute.manager. The original patch missed these places.

There will be subsequent patch(es) handling the same edge cases
for soft_delete and force_delete.

Change-Id: If0693eab2ed31b5fbfe6cbafa5d67b69c2ed8442
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

Change-Id: I7b5d0d28f134599d8ac0bf12533ff8be754fd032
'}]
commit_message:
Transform missing delete notifications

The Iddbe50ce0ad3c14562df800bbc09ec5a7e840485 patch only considered
instance delete in the happy case when the instance is scheduled to a
compute successfully and the compute is available when the delete
action is executed. If the instance is never scheduled to a compute or
the compute is not available when the instance is deleted legacy delete
notifications are emitted from different places, compute.api instead of
compute.manager. The original patch missed these places.

There will be subsequent patch(es) handling the same edge cases
for soft_delete and force_delete.

Change-Id: If0693eab2ed31b5fbfe6cbafa5d67b69c2ed8442
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

Change-Id: I7b5d0d28f134599d8ac0bf12533ff8be754fd032

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-26 08:43:46.000000000', 'message': 'Support storage of introspection data in Nginx

As an operator I want to be able to persist raw and processed
introspection data so that I am able to view it at a later date.

As an operator I want to be able to persist raw and processed
introspection data so that I am able to reprocess the data after the
initial inspection process has completed.

In the absence of swift, we can use the bifrost nginx web server -
masquerading as an object store - to store raw and processed
introspection data for nodes.

This allows introspection data to be retrieved and reprocessed after the
initial inspection has completed. This can be useful when the processing
pipeline or introspection rules are changed.

Change-Id: Ia2bd16080594e854054f380d4f7670eaea98e82b
Closes-Bug: #1685879

commit_message:
Support storage of introspection data in Nginx

As an operator I want to be able to persist raw and processed
introspection data so that I am able to view it at a later date.

As an operator I want to be able to persist raw and processed
introspection data so that I am able to reprocess the data after the
initial inspection process has completed.

In the absence of swift, we can use the bifrost nginx web server -
masquerading as an object store - to store raw and processed
introspection data for nodes.

This allows introspection data to be retrieved and reprocessed after the
initial inspection has completed. This can be useful when the processing
pipeline or introspection rules are changed.

Change-Id: Ia2bd16080594e854054f380d4f7670eaea98e82b
Closes-Bug: #1685879

commit_message:
Fixes securitygroups_rpc usage

Some neutron.agent.securitygroups_rpc classes moved to
neutron.api.rpc.handlers.securitygroups_rpc, and they were removed
from master.

Because of this, the networking-hyperv agents can't start.

Change-Id: Iffa271bc837fa19134097b364dc1c7afc277d32e

commit_message:
Use upper constraints when installing virtualbmc

The lack of UC means that pip is attempting to install libvirt-python
4.1.0, which is failing on Ubuntu due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1753539.

Currently upper-constraints limits libvirt-python to 4.0.0, which does
not have this issue.

Change-Id: I97e055aa1d4ebdd85693eeb8228b58a6bc9bad9a
Related-Bug: #1753539

to the list of default enabled hardware types. This hardware type does
not exist - the Cisco UCS hardware types are cisco-ucs-managed and

commit_message:
Enabled hardware type 'ucs' does not exist

During classic driver deprecation [1], the ucs hardware type was added
to the list of default enabled hardware types. This hardware type does
not exist - the Cisco UCS hardware types are cisco-ucs-managed and
cisco-ucs-standalone. This causes conductor to fail to start.

This was not caught during testing as only the ipmi ironic hardware type
is configured when testing. Now that VBMC is in use, it is no
longer necessary to use a different set of drivers for testing.

This change enables the cisco-ucs-managed hardware type by default, and
uses the default set of drivers and hardware types for testing. It also
adds configuration options for setting the enabled boot, power and
management interfaces, with default values including interfaces required
by the ilo and ucs hardware types.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/46453661badf83c2c45a008908d4476de6785ccd

Change-Id: Icfa89a2555966c6fbfd06186fdd17d852bc5ae7a
Closes-Bug: #1752975

commit_message:
Fixes OpenDaylight healthcheck

Due to Jetty XML config changes for OpenDaylight, healtcheck no longer
works.  This patch moves the healtcheck to use the pax web config file,
which should be a more consistent method of finding the values for host
IP/port (INI settings).  Also adds logic to support healthcheck with TLS
based deployments.

Closes-Bug: 1751928

Change-Id: I94f351ee3c71ddefe0b5c2bfdcd784d303ccbb24
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

Deployments with OpenDaylight fail because the Docker healthcheck fails.
This is due to the fact that the URL used for querying with the

commit_message:
Fixes OpenDaylight healthcheck/GUI feature

Deployments with OpenDaylight fail because the Docker healthcheck fails.
This is due to the fact that the URL used for querying with the
healthcheck is not available, due to a feature mismatch.  This patch
fixes the GUI feature being installed to address the issue.

Closes-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: Ia62aebb9c03e09c1986c1592a38ab455e68fd103
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add multi pools support

This patch adds support for nodes with different vif drivers as
well as different pool drivers for each vif driver type.

Closes-Bug: 1747406
Change-Id: I842fd4b513a5f325d598d677e5008f9ea51adab9

subject: [WIP] Remove unneeded clients from heat
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 22:08:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Remove unneeded clients from heat

Heat brings in all of the OpenStack clients and this causes delays
during the repo build. The python-monsascaclient dependencies take
5-8 minutes to build in the OpenStack gates.

This patch is absolutely horrible, but it aims to limit which clients
are installed based on what the deployer is using.

Related-Bug: 1745215
Change-Id: I2f215faf2a7ef043cabd1cf3692f03e2e0131c5e

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove unneeded clients from heat

Heat brings in all of the OpenStack clients and this causes delays
during the repo build. The python-monsascaclient dependencies take
5-8 minutes to build in the OpenStack gates.

This patch is absolutely horrible, but it aims to limit which clients
are installed based on what the deployer is using.

Related-Bug: 1745215
Change-Id: I2f215faf2a7ef043cabd1cf3692f03e2e0131c5e

they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: Ieef26209557ee008b6c8dbe044207b630174d0f2

[{'created': '2018-03-05 12:09:56.000000000', 'message': 'ScaleIO Driver: Document support for ScaleIO 2.5

Add newly released version of ScaleIO to the list of
supported versions within the Configuration Guide. While there
simplify the document to refer to official ScaleIO docs for
any specifics.

Change-Id: Ibdef4b2d464a418f82ef0684659dd1cf4896b7b2
(cherry picked from commit 475f5ad864df171926ac7518449967162f682cf2)

commit_message:
ScaleIO Driver: Document support for ScaleIO 2.5

Add newly released version of ScaleIO to the list of
supported versions within the Configuration Guide. While there
simplify the document to refer to official ScaleIO docs for
any specifics.

Change-Id: Ibdef4b2d464a418f82ef0684659dd1cf4896b7b2
(cherry picked from commit 475f5ad864df171926ac7518449967162f682cf2)

commit_message:
Trigger restarts of pool manager when db updates

If the pools yaml changes and the leader runs the manage command
to update the database then restart the pool manager.

Change-Id: Iaf769c718e574670552fe61fcff753eb0ae8160b
Closes-Bug: #1753722

[{'created': '2018-02-20 19:54:36.000000000', 'message': "[Linuxbridge] Check if vxlan network MTU can be set

In case when MTU value configured for VXLAN network is
higher than physical device's MTU - 50 (VXLAN overhead)
then Linuxbridge agent will log proper error message.

Change-Id: I2c1142877fee4ab2fa06e6e4d203c78a776d9591
Related-Bug: #1744101
"}]
commit_message:
[Linuxbridge] Check if vxlan network MTU can be set

In case when MTU value configured for VXLAN network is
higher than physical device's MTU - 50 (VXLAN overhead)
then Linuxbridge agent will log proper error message.

Change-Id: I2c1142877fee4ab2fa06e6e4d203c78a776d9591
Related-Bug: #1744101

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 22:57:49.000000000', 'message': 'cni health: track all cgroup memory usage

The CNI daemon should always be run in its own cgroup. That typically
can take two forms:

- Running inside a container
- Running as a systemd service

This patch changes the way the memory usage is tracked so that both
of the cgroup memberships listed above are supported.

Thanks to using cgroups for tracking the memory usage, we will finally
take into account the CNI daemon children memory usage.

Change-Id: I0ef48742653d5c17ea0cc787ae3a997d5d315c5a
Closes-Bug: 1752939
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
cni health: track all cgroup memory usage

The CNI daemon should always be run in its own cgroup. That typically
can take two forms:

- Running inside a container
- Running as a systemd service

This patch changes the way the memory usage is tracked so that both
of the cgroup memberships listed above are supported.

Thanks to using cgroups for tracking the memory usage, we will finally
take into account the CNI daemon children memory usage.

Change-Id: I0ef48742653d5c17ea0cc787ae3a997d5d315c5a
Closes-Bug: 1752939
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Do not try and download zones for empty url

If the leader has updated the sync time but not yet published
a src url then the charm can attempt to download the zones from
an empty url

Change-Id: If50872887c9bf993f1524c6bb1e3cad03eda5809
Closes-Bug: #1753980

This patchset adds missing "host" option to "options" section in
"/etc/designate/pools.yaml" file which is causing the designate
pool manager service to send notifications to localhost on every
zone change.

'}]
commit_message:
Add missing "host" options to "pools.yaml"

This patchset adds missing "host" option to "options" section in
"/etc/designate/pools.yaml" file which is causing the designate
pool manager service to send notifications to localhost on every
zone change.

Change-Id: Icb189038ff7e1e48588430b3f08c3d8aa676811f
Closes-Bug: 1752861

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 19:21:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix issue with double mocking of utils.execute functions

An issue was discovered if we mock an already mock-ed function. This
was happening in our execute() detection code. Change it to not use a
mock and instead a function.

Fix a failing unit test. This was due to the fact that using
'autospec=True' causes assert_not_called() to not work. This is a
known bug in the mock code[1].

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue28380

Change-Id: Ifa18df61d17750f9a37118a2ac8aaf13005a5159
"}, {'created': '2017-12-01 18:24:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix issue with double mocking of utils.execute functions

An issue was discovered if we mock an already mock-ed function. This
was happening in our execute() detection code. Change it to not use a
mock and instead a function.

Fix a failing unit test. This was due to the fact that using
'autospec=True' causes assert_not_called() to not work. This is a
known bug in the mock code[1].

Add test cases to ensure it works as expected.

commit_message:
Fix issue with double mocking of utils.execute functions

An issue was discovered if we mock an already mock-ed function. This
was happening in our execute() detection code. Change it to not use a
mock and instead a function.

Fix a failing unit test. This was due to the fact that using
'autospec=True' causes assert_not_called() to not work. This is a
known bug in the mock code[1].

Add test cases to ensure it works as expected.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue28380

Change-Id: Ifa18df61d17750f9a37118a2ac8aaf13005a5159

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Bulk create support

VMAX support for bulk create support in the create group API

This patch is still WIP.  Submitted for PTG discussion

TODO:
* Error handling
* Support for non GVG supporting drivers
* Quotas
* Unit tests
* Tempest tests

Change-Id: I44602a0f2564de3de11ae986379094dad9aa1a2e
Implements: blueprint vmax-bulk-create-vol-in-create-group-api

commit_message:
Extract log level from syslog

By default the syslog input plugin won't extract the
log level from a syslog message. By setting the priority
key, the log level is extracted.

Partial-Bug: #1725240
Change-Id: I9ad5f5e1c875ef62b39fbbba7b271d98cee68dd6

[{'created': '2018-02-06 10:24:41.000000000', 'message': "ovs-fw: Don't modify passed rules to update

When rules are passed to update() method of firewall, it translates
protocol in case it was passed as a string to integer. This can cause a
side-effect in testing when same set of rules is passed multiple times.
Securiry group rules always have a string in protocol field.

"}]
commit_message:
ovs-fw: Don't modify passed rules to update

When rules are passed to update() method of firewall, it translates
protocol in case it was passed as a string to integer. This can cause a
side-effect in testing when same set of rules is passed multiple times.
Securiry group rules always have a string in protocol field.

Change-Id: I0d95c6c41ad3c4b52986307449d90f13bbd412ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 16:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Correct Neutron RabbitMQ User Param Mapping

Changed parameter mapping for RabbitMQ user name
overrides. THT maps the user name override to
neutron::rabbit_user for the Neutron service only.

This will allow the transport_url string to be built
correctly when a deployer wishes to override the default
guest username.

Change-Id: I0e35a6979765a453e2ed219e6026f6c0a17b2013
Closes-Bug: 1746034
'}]
commit_message:
Correct Neutron RabbitMQ User Param Mapping

Changed parameter mapping for RabbitMQ user name
overrides. THT maps the user name override to
neutron::rabbit_user for the Neutron service only.

This will allow the transport_url string to be built
correctly when a deployer wishes to override the default
guest username.

Change-Id: I0e35a6979765a453e2ed219e6026f6c0a17b2013
Closes-Bug: 1746034

If so, that'd depend on neutron-lbaas/octavia, it'll create pods, etc. Wouldn't we be including many variables in this voting job? > > (1 comment)

 > to run kuryr tempest tests? If so, that'd depend on
 > neutron-lbaas/octavia, it'll create pods, etc. Wouldn't we be
 > including many variables in this voting job? Wouldn't it make more
 > sense to let them try that using an OVN backend job?

Hi yeah, we will need to run the kuryr tempest tests.

Depends on what they want to test, if they want to detect changes in networking-ovn that will break the kuryr compatibility they have to keep it in our gate. If they want to test changes in kuryr that breaks the compatibility with networking-ovn it needs to run on their gate.

Right now kuryr job (which is voting) is not even deploying

commit_message:
Fix kuryr job

Right now kuryr job (which is voting) is not even deploying
networking-ovn nor kuryr so it's pointless. This patch is
fixing it but we need to decide whether it makes sense to
run it or not because our tempest tests won't be exercising
kuryr at all. If we decide to run kuryr tempest tests, we'll
need to depend on neutron-lbaas or octavia and it'll add new
(unwanted?) dependencies to our gate, especially since it's
voting.

Closes-bug: #1748857

Change-Id: Icbea7b6c92b4f29615e9da17f8b8d02c823a91ba
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add NodeTLSData to generic role.role.j2.yaml

This is currently included in the controller-role template, so we need
to add it to the generic role.role.j2.yaml in order to convert the
controller-role template to be rendered via j2

Conflicts:
	puppet/role.role.j2.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1751017
Change-Id: I01bf01c8a31e4cc26f202dd1774845ec33f50bcd
(cherry picked from commit 98d6d84ca31086e2486b830a147f3538ba079a73)

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server

commit_message:
Increase size of Heat max_template_size

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat 'max_template_size' default value was 1M.
In instack-undercloud we bumped it to 2M, bug #1667697.
This change increases it to 4MB.

Change-Id: Ic913ecb44dac800131292d1f3661be5b71f35a78
Closes-Bug: 1752467
(cherry picked from commit 8ae1c7d8fa397a398c4181b2e0b2bbd62b23cb1b)

commit_message:
Use tenacity to retry image pulls

Image pulls often fail due to network or registry load. This change
implements pull retries, up to 4 times with jittered exponential
backoff.

Closes-Bug #1752036

Change-Id: I09c601f357200e734aa9d887c6ce6b4e53fc2589
(cherry picked from commit 5c7a785053b96cf1faf3eee5b673f90a71a2f056)

commit_message:
functional: Fix RABBIT_PASSWORD env var

Caller of configure_func_for_testing.sh script is able to override default
password for rabbit service. This patch replaces RABBIT_HOST as a
password to RABBIT_PASSWORD env var.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie9cafc1fb75209ae1cacc58f254c1da33521d6b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 11:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Concurrency issues involving replicated volumes

VMAX driver currently has some limitations surrounding concurrent
operations involving replicated volumes. The next version of Unisphere
for VMAX has some improvements made in this area. One of these
improvements is on volume retrieval from the array. This patch switches
to the 90 endpoint on volume retrieval, where supported, to utilize
the improvement.

Change-Id: I0ac7f98e529961ab559289e257b4f58c8577e121
Closes-bug: 1753707
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Concurrency issues involving replicated volumes

VMAX driver currently has some limitations surrounding concurrent
operations involving replicated volumes. The next version of Unisphere
for VMAX has some improvements made in this area. One of these
improvements is on volume retrieval from the array. This patch switches
to the 90 endpoint on volume retrieval, where supported, to utilize
the improvement.

Change-Id: I0ac7f98e529961ab559289e257b4f58c8577e121
Closes-bug: 1753707

commit_message:
Fix false-negative failure report for mysqldump backup

If mysqldump command has redirect part for stderr, catching error logic
by stderr doest not work as expected. Remove redirect part to report
BackupError normally for sqldump failure.

Change-Id: I2c10ae7b6b6094af7819594e889385b0ed77fe4b
Close-Bug: 1753498

commit_message:

deletion of the trunk interface on a HUAWEI switch.

Fixes Bug: #1753876

commit_message:
Fix gate job failure

Due to the infra change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519533/, some
"non-standard" things have been removed which include mongoDB and Redis.
Now based on the policy, we have to keep one in Zaqar repo.

Change-Id: I4505af56b015a004f9f1ba7f6aaddd5ca31a30b0

commit_message:
Remove --skip-metering-database for ceilometer

The --skip-metering-database argument for
the ceilometer-upgrade script has been removed
but are still used in the integration code and
was missed because Ubuntu was non-voting and
RHEL based packages seems to be an older version.

This patch depends on the change in puppetceilometer
that changes the default value for extra_params [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548599/

Depends-On: I33c1667e19326ec67c5cf953daa1237175895c4f
Change-Id: I49f988afa96685b8d44f51525fa2d76731463bbf

commit_message:
Do not skip gnocchi resource type creation by default in db::sync

The default command-line option for ceilometer-upgrade is to not
skip gnocchi resource type creation. If we do not pass any extra_params
to the ceilometer::db::sync class, we should keep defaults.

This has not failed before in CI because p-o-i was passing
'--skip-metering-database' as extra_params, but now we are removing
that deprecated option in [1].

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/548337

Change-Id: I33c1667e19326ec67c5cf953daa1237175895c4f

commit_message:
update monasca-common min 2.7.0

oslo-poilicy enforcement engine is added in monasca-common
for the first time in this version and other monasca projects
which have oslo-policy can not work with the lower version of
 monasca-common.

Change-Id: Id6a65acb6962937637f3e8c5f7c995bca44aa30a
Signed-off-by: Amir Mofakhar <amofakhar@op5.com>

commit_message:
Switch automatically configures trunk interface

The switch automatically configuring the trunk interface for ironic bond.
Use the local_group_information information in port to
create trunk and delete the trunk interface.

Fixes Bug: #1753876

Change-Id: I0b6c3178ad7571ccba75ad68a32d8ce132041aa7

commit_message:
Add the delete port command for the HUAWEI switch

Delete the port command for the HUAWEI switch and
delete the previously configured VLAN information.

Change-Id: I464542ca77bb30379947b6bfc2dd977f6276c25f
Closes-Bug: #1753920

The Patch Set 1 tests show no deprecation warning: http://logs.openstack.org/72/547672/1/check/barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest/9b11e34/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-27_05_32_11_404758'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-02-28 22:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 21:53:13.000000000', 'message': 'Address verifier DeprecationWarning

The use of signer and verifier in cryptography has been
deprecated, and causes the following warning:

barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/barbican_manager.py:139:
DeprecationWarning: signer and verifier have been deprecated.
Please use sign and verify instead.

This patch replaces signer with sign.

Change-Id: Ia6358e2c4e84faa9d692a13b9b3aa1504407301b
'}]
commit_message:
Address verifier DeprecationWarning

The use of signer and verifier in cryptography has been
deprecated, and causes the following warning:

barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/barbican_manager.py:139:
DeprecationWarning: signer and verifier have been deprecated.
Please use sign and verify instead.

This patch replaces signer with sign.

Change-Id: Ia6358e2c4e84faa9d692a13b9b3aa1504407301b

subject: manila: port pre- and post-test hooks to Ansible playbooks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 8056, 'name': 'Ramana Raja', 'email': 'rraja@redhat.com', 'username': 'Ram_Raja'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 17780, 'name': 'Dustin Schoenbrun', 'email': 'dschoenb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dschoenb'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-03-05 14:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-05 14:51:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You don't need to use lineinfile and convert the hooks in ansible. Just drop them; all the options can be specified as variables for the job.
Few items (like setting iptables) should be moved to the devstack plugin. Check the PTG notes too."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2018-03-05 15:56:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This work is not necessary. We will be leveraging zuulv3 framework to handle this logic on the jobs. It has been discussed that this work will be done gradually (I'll propose modifications to the manila-tempest-plugin repo and after a few weeks we will drop this scripts) since we need to give third parties time to update this on their CI."}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-03-07 08:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 14:39:20.000000000', 'message': 'manila: port pre- and post-test hooks to Ansible playbooks

Since Zuul is on its 3rd version, rewrite pre-test-hook.sh and
post-test-hook.sh to Ansible playbooks to use Zuulv3 framework
effectively and to avoid creating new legacy jobs. Also, for
legacy jobs, leave the current bash scripts for the hooks as it is.

Change-Id: I475184f17e066a5eed25ea89d2b0a8eb7dcb5a50
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
manila: port pre- and post-test hooks to Ansible playbooks

Since Zuul is on its 3rd version, rewrite pre-test-hook.sh and
post-test-hook.sh to Ansible playbooks to use Zuulv3 framework
effectively and to avoid creating new legacy jobs. Also, for
legacy jobs, leave the current bash scripts for the hooks as it is.

Change-Id: I475184f17e066a5eed25ea89d2b0a8eb7dcb5a50
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-05-24 09:22:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add openstack undercloud backup

This new option allow to run a backup
prior any critical action like an upgrade.

If you want to try this new openstack undercloud option
in your dev env:

1- Copy the content of undercloud.py to:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud.py

2- Register the plugin in the entry points:
  Update: /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/python_tripleoclient-7.0.1.dev27-py2.7.egg-info/entry_points.txt
  Appending: undercloud_backup = tripleoclient.v1.undercloud:BackupUndercloud       at the end of the file

You should be able to test the CLI then.

Change-Id: Ief10f5313244d2848b6de604e0493a51db1ed30f

Undercloud backup, for example:

commit_message:
Add Openstack Undercloud backup

This new option allows to call the Mistral workflow to run an Undercloud full
backup.

Usage: openstack undercloud backup [--add-path ADD_FILES_TO_BACKUP]

The --add-path allows to add additional files or folders to the
Undercloud backup, for example:

openstack undercloud backup --add-path /etc/hosts \
                            --add-path /var/log/

Depends-on: Iebd67568d5e72967e694b88fc8c73361543929a1
Change-Id: Ief10f5313244d2848b6de604e0493a51db1ed30f
Related bp undercloud-backup-restore

[{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 16:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 17:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-22 17:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-22 19:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This needs a release job set up for the repo in project-config.

"deliverables/_independent/oswin-tempest-plugin.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'openstack-python-jobs', 'openstack-*"

Adding "publish-to-pypi" after here should do it:

https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L12404

That will need to merge there first before this release can be processed.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-23 10:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:27:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Accidental discovery the inaccurate info in guestagent-api
annotation about async and sync. So just correct them.

subject: Release os-win 3.0.1 (Queens)
messages:
[{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this release critical for queens? Non-client library freeze was last Thursday.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:17:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's not. It primarely contains 2 bug fixes which are of interest:

- Fixes MAC spoofing update issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win/+bug/1744755

- Flush named pipes (necessary for nova to avoid incomplete instance console log files): https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win/+bug/1741494

It's something that we'll want in Queens anyways, and AFAIK, branching is being done via tag."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-23 20:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> It's not. It primarely contains 2 bug fixes which are of interest:
 > 
 > - Fixes MAC spoofing update issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win/+bug/1744755
 > 
 > - Flush named pipes (necessary for nova to avoid incomplete
 > instance console log files): https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win/+bug/1741494
 > 
 > It's something that we'll want in Queens anyways, and AFAIK,
 > branching is being done via tag.

It sounds like we want to hold off on this, branch from the existing tag, and backport the fixes.

The alternative is to wait to create the branch until we tag this release, but that won't happen until after the Queens final release date now and so changes to the repo will start running tests against Rocky for a little while (and receiving Rocky requirements updates). So I don't think we want that."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agreed this should be done as 3.0.1 on stable/queens at this point'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-02 17:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-02 19:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do you need this to be released before we lift the normal library freeze? If so, have you coordinated with the requirements team to ensure the constraint update is approved?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-03 14:23:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just to expand on what has already been said - if this is critical for the Queens release, then you will need to do something similar to what was done here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/126929.html

As we will need a requirements FFE to get this in queens yet.

If it's important, but not critical, the other option is we wait, and we can do a stable release for this right away once the lib freeze is over."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 13:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The release itself looks fine to me, so +1 until we get the constraint update approval worked out.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-07 23:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

So yeah looking at this release which is fine but probably not at this stage.

If we were to include this we'd need to look at also cascade releases of os-brick and glance_store.

So yeah we need to understand the impact here."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

-1 until there is a FFE filed for the late release'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-27 10:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-28 09:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

This should wait until next week.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Holding off approving until I've had a chance to sync with the rest of the release team."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

subject: Senlin queens release
messages:
[{'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-26 05:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-26 07:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please do not change the branch location setting. That needs to always refer to the version where the branch was created.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-26 09:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-26 09:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is past final RC deadline and we are preparing the final release with this patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547519/2/deliverables/queens/senlin.yaml

If you had additional commits after the final RC, this will need to wait to be released as a stable release after the final Queens release goes out.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-26 14:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Sean If no bug fixes are allowed to RC, why we call it release candidates then? We could have called the RC2 or RC1 as final, right? My previous understanding is that RC2 is "almost complete" to be released. No further patches are allowed, *unless* the project team sees an critical patch to be merged. That is the reason we have RCs.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-26 14:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There are certainly multiple release candidates possible for each project. The problem here is this is now past the deadline and we are just about to do the final Queens release and transition to Rocky.

https://releases.openstack.org/queens/schedule.html#q-finalrc'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-26 16:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Sean, thanks for the info. Looks like I'm still confused by the release schedule page. It says that Feb 19 - Feb 23 is for last RC, and Feb 26 - Mar 02 is for the final release. We have been checking that page regularly in case we may miss some deadlines. We have been reading the Feb26-Mar 02 time window as the last chance to get a patch released into the final version.
Maybe we can propose the has ID to your https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547519/ patch?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-26 16:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry you misread that, but "last RC" means that is the last chance to do another RC. As mentioned in the weekly countdown emails, we then enter a week quiet period to get everything in place before we mark those last RCs as our final release.

After Wednesday, stable/queens becomes a normal stable branch and additional stable releases can be done off of that point. So depending on your changes, you can then do a 5.0.1 or 5.1.0 stable/queens release.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> @Sean, thanks for the info. Looks like I'm still confused by the
 > release schedule page. It says that Feb 19 - Feb 23 is for last RC,
 > and Feb 26 - Mar 02 is for the final release. We have been checking
 > that page regularly in case we may miss some deadlines. We have
 > been reading the Feb26-Mar 02 time window as the last chance to get
 > a patch released into the final version.
 > Maybe we can propose the has ID to your https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547519/
 > patch?

The "release candidate" process means that we turn a "candidate" into the "final" release because the point of preparing candidates is to let users test them. So, the last chance to get a patch into the final release is the deadline for the last candidate.

However, the "final" release is not the "only" release. We can prepare a patch release as early as next week, so if you change this patch to propose a patch release instead then we can process it that way. We will probably wait until late next week since we are traveling.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:21:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Doug, thanks for review.
So basically you mean it is okay to have a 5.0.1 release version. I'm fine with that. I was just curious about the process."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-02 13:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-02 13:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-03 05:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:22:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I haven't had a chance to coordinate with the rest of the release team on whether it is OK to approve releases, but this one looks good."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

From the validate job logs:

  2 errors found
  deliverables/_independent/vitrage-tempest-plugin.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/vitrage-tempest-plugin, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'check-requirements', 'tempest-plugin-jobs'] or no release will be published
  deliverables/_independent/vitrage-tempest-plugin.yaml: tarball-base for openstack/vitrage-tempest-plugin 1.0.0 defaults to 'vitrage-tempest-plugin' but the sdist name is actually 'vitrage_tempest_tests'. It is too expensive to determine this value during the site build, please set it explicitly."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> From the validate job logs:
 > 
 > 2 errors found

 > 'vitrage-tempest-plugin' but the sdist name is actually
 > 'vitrage_tempest_tests'. It is too expensive to determine this
 > value during the site build, please set it explicitly.

The first issue should be fixed by the Depends-On change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546667/ 

The second issue was fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546886/. I'll recheck now so the fix will take effect."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-02-22 20:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Change timeout for upgrade periodics from 3hrs to 4hrs

Given that a deployment takes up to 2 hrs to complete,
it stands to reason that an upgrade would take twice
as long.

Change-Id: Ia350d0d73bd1d31c523142d3421ac4792f416d08

commit_message:
Move db MAX constants to own file

The "MAX" constants in the db api are useful to import without
needing to import the rest of the api, so they are moved to a
constants.py file in the same package. api.py then imports the
symbols from that file for backwards compatibility.

The handler and schema for placement inventories (which use the MAX
constants) are updated to point to the constants file directly as
they do not need the db api.

Change-Id: Ifab10e023bcf4389f6514b477755c4cced2d1598

[{'created': '2018-02-28 14:53:35.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: verify subnet has gateway_ip before installing IPv4 flow

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying
to install the DVR IPv4 flow.  Do not install the flow
in this case since it is not required.

Change-Id: I79aba63498aa9af1156e37530627fcaec853a740
Closes-bug: #1728665
(cherry picked from commit 9be7b62f773d3f61da57c151bfbd5c8fe4d4e863)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: verify subnet has gateway_ip before installing IPv4 flow

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying
to install the DVR IPv4 flow.  Do not install the flow
in this case since it is not required.

Change-Id: I79aba63498aa9af1156e37530627fcaec853a740
Closes-bug: #1728665
(cherry picked from commit 9be7b62f773d3f61da57c151bfbd5c8fe4d4e863)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 20:23:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This adds "nspawn" to
as an option to the `container_tech` variable. To support this change,
The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
new group named `nspawn_hosts`. All of the container connectivity and
setup are stored within the integrated repo under the new templates
directory.

The addition of "nspawn" container driver enables the ability for
deployers to change, or mix container technologies within a single
deployment without needing to change our well defined network
topology or storage layout.

Depends-On: I13d05ba8bcfe785257a9cf98dbdb6024ec937816
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit fd9cda8df9b9f9e286624237d0fff639b5dc38e9)

commit_message:
Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This adds "nspawn" to
as an option to the `container_tech` variable. To support this change,
The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
new group named `nspawn_hosts`. All of the container connectivity and
setup are stored within the integrated repo under the new templates
directory.

The addition of "nspawn" container driver enables the ability for
deployers to change, or mix container technologies within a single
deployment without needing to change our well defined network
topology or storage layout.

Depends-On: I13d05ba8bcfe785257a9cf98dbdb6024ec937816
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit fd9cda8df9b9f9e286624237d0fff639b5dc38e9)

commit_message:
Install vanilla Python 2.7 on CentOS 7 with pyenv

The default Python 2.7 version on CentOS 7 has plenty of security
enhancments built in at compile time. Although these enhancements
are valuable when running daemons that listen on the network, they
are not as useful when simply running Ansible.

This patch compiles a more vanilla version of Python 2.7 on the
system and uses it with the ansible-runtime venv. This should allow
Ansible to execute slightly faster.

Change-Id: I5fcc02104ed20d9f92210ff6afe51ecf97b7a281

commit_message:
Change default value for devstack variable

Changing the default value of devstack variable
IRONIC_DEFAULT_BOOT_OPTION to 'local' to match with the
corresponding change to default value of Ironic configuration
[deploy]/default_boot_option

Depends-On: I1692037759690dad2c096c35876d3656103f0f70

Change-Id: I731b214f113243fb44d66b0fa6a15b8d32278327
Closes-Bug: #1619339

commit_message:
Return 204 instead of 200 for root-disable API

As no content will be returned to the client if a root-disable request
succeeds, a HTTP 204 (Not Content) response is more appropriate.

Redis root-disable scenario test fails because it's return HTTP 204, but
all API related tests are expecting a HTTP 200. Although changing Redis
root-disable API is a much simpler way to resolve the problem, migrating
from HTTP 200 to HTTP 204 should be a better solution. Related tests and
documents are also updated accordingly.

APIImpact

Change-Id: If732a578009fd35436e810fb7ceceefd1ada3778
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix exception about loadbalancer_stats

Octavia send loadbalancer statistics through rabbit with type
loadbalancer_stats but neutron_lbaas does not support this type.

Closes-Bug: #1636380
Change-Id: Ib50c8aad8ce4a8393d69f9c271a8cfb7bedac086
(cherry picked from commit 4a5af034520a4a7da1604efb853ba5b0ec8a46e7)

subject: Enable automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 09:39:51.000000000', 'message': 'Enable automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types

The new online data migration in ironic will migrate nodes from classic drivers
to hardware types. However, it will skip nodes with one or more target
hardware interfaces not enabled. In the undercloud we don't enable certain
implementations that we do not support (e.g. "agent" RAID and
"ipmitool-shellinabox" console for the "ipmi" hardware type).
To allow the migration to work, set a special option to reset these

commit_message:
Enable automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types

The new online data migration in ironic will migrate nodes from classic drivers
to hardware types. However, it will skip nodes with one or more target
hardware interfaces not enabled. In the undercloud we don't enable certain
implementations that we do not support (e.g. "agent" RAID and
"ipmitool-shellinabox" console for the "ipmi" hardware type).
To allow the migration to work, set a special option to reset these
interfaces to their no-op equivalents ("no-raid", "no-console", etc).

Change-Id: Iba1e82d47c0e22613b06b99f0a9d0f4b3082bbe7
Related-Bug: #1690185
(cherry picked from commit 3756d3d60f50c8f84639bea0410c014e5c1cb307)

commit_message:
Flush entire interface rather than just routes

This patch changes the flush routes handler to flush the entire
interface config from the interface. This is needed because
systemd-networkd does not restore the route of non-DHCP interfaces
when flushing routes and restarting systemd-networks.

Change-Id: I17748b0dd2307fd9bee705140c67883140090298
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
Improve doc structure

The current top page of heat-dashboard doc is a bit tricky.
The content of installation is duplicated, for example.

This commit revisit the document structure.

* Drop installation instruction from README
* Drop meaningless indices and tables (which are not working)
* Move DevStack setup to the contributor document
* Merge installation_contents.rst into installation.rst

Change-Id: I897cfe0094358db63a364088fd2b977e234101e8

commit_message:
Use neutronclient for floatingip operations

As add_floating_ip and remove_floating_ip were removed from novaclient,
migrating to neutronclient for floatingip operations.

This is the first patch for fixing unittests. As integration tests
didn't fail, floatingip operations are not covered there, so it may be
necessary to add new scenario tests for this in following patches.

Change-Id: Ic41f5898db77a09158e0f8bfa4196bdb5e40b49a
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-26 02:02:03.000000000', 'message': '     1. What is the problem?

     During the deletion of a network which is mapped to several
     local networks, if the local neutron server receives a network-get
     request, it will bring some conflict operations. For example,
     we delete local networks before deleting central network. If a
     "get_network" request comes to a local neutron server after the
     local network is completely deleted in that region, if central network
     is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local networks),
     Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local network will be recreated.

     2. What is the solution to the problem?

     The solution to resource deleting is covered in
     specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

     3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

     No new features.

     Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

Change-Id: I7b3c1efb88c693c3babccdfc865fa560922ede28
'}, {'created': '2017-12-26 02:05:03.000000000', 'message': '     code for resource deleting

     request, it will bring some conflict operations. For example,
     we delete local networks before deleting central network. If a
     "get_network" request comes to a local neutron server after the
     local network is completely deleted in that region, if central network
     is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local networks),
     Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local network will be recreated.

     2. What is the solution to the problem?

     The solution to resource deleting is covered in
     specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

     3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

     No new features.

     Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

Change-Id: I7b3c1efb88c693c3babccdfc865fa560922ede28

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: CR_hui <CR_hui@126.com>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7b3c1efb88c693c3babccdfc865fa560922ede28
'}, {'created': '2017-12-28 03:15:20.000000000', 'message': 'code for resource deleting

1. What is the problem?

During the deletion of a network which is mapped to several
local networks, if the local neutron server receives a network-get
request, it will bring some conflict operations. For example,
we delete local networks before deleting central network. If a
"get_network" request comes to a local neutron server after the
local network is completely deleted in that region, if central network
is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local networks),
Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local network will be recreated.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: CR_hui <CR_hui@126.com>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

commit_message:
code for resource deleting

1. What is the problem?

During the deletion of a network which is mapped to several
local networks, if the local neutron server receives a network-get
request, it will bring some conflict operations. For example,
we delete local networks before deleting central network. If a
"get_network" request comes to a local neutron server after the
local network is completely deleted in that region, if central network
is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local networks),
Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local network
will be recreated.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: CR_hui <CR_hui@126.com>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7b3c1efb88c693c3babccdfc865fa560922ede28

subject: Get message from websocket instead from zaqarclient directly

commit_message:
Get message from websocket instead from zaqarclient directly

Use the websocket api to get and print the real time
ansible execution for minor update instead of using the
zaqarclient call directly.
This is safer and avoid brutal claim of the messages.

Change-Id: I7e324b9e037197082c23a19b4e4b8832daaf5aee
(cherry picked from commit eaa2e9ce75dbc107d9624a2a7325d3d8ec212a0a)

commit_message:
Add generic methods to upload files to plan

Either by local filename or by content directly. These will come in
handy for preserving content on plan update.

Change-Id: I5dea8c71b86bd35883cbe417e7aba01d69c9ab26
Partial-Bug: #1749700
(cherry picked from commit ef23c77ee8a0b03550631f3e40c45d4a786e271e)

[{'created': '2018-03-06 11:52:19.000000000', 'message': 'Inherit UpdateCommand class from overcloud DeployCommand class

Instead of dealing with some decidated functions in Update/upgrade
classes for manipulating the plan and the env files,
inherit the update class from the DeployCommand class will allow the
update && upgrade to take benefit from the plan management code
and all the tips and tricks that the deploy class does for handling
the corner cases of the plan (access rights, path of user files)
Also it avoid to rewrite/duplicate some code to solve the issue where
the --templates option is ignored by the update workflow
(and upgrade for Queens btw).
Related tripleo-common review:
https://review.openstack.org/540816

Depends-On: Ica4bb404cd3a38a97300b8af36af41c35f09825c
Change-Id: Ib96f4f5078ec1c45981d051e546bf931d2885ae2
(cherry picked from commit 6ca0ee146da5ac6feb8c50374139151047092c95)
'}]
commit_message:
Inherit UpdateCommand class from overcloud DeployCommand class

Instead of dealing with some decidated functions in Update/upgrade
classes for manipulating the plan and the env files,
inherit the update class from the DeployCommand class will allow the
update && upgrade to take benefit from the plan management code
and all the tips and tricks that the deploy class does for handling
the corner cases of the plan (access rights, path of user files)
Also it avoid to rewrite/duplicate some code to solve the issue where
the --templates option is ignored by the update workflow
(and upgrade for Queens btw).
Related tripleo-common review:
https://review.openstack.org/540816

Depends-On: Ica4bb404cd3a38a97300b8af36af41c35f09825c
Change-Id: Ib96f4f5078ec1c45981d051e546bf931d2885ae2
(cherry picked from commit 6ca0ee146da5ac6feb8c50374139151047092c95)

commit_message:
Pass the queue_name to messaging_websocket function for update

For update and upgrade, we need to pass a different queue name
to the websocket in order to read the ansible runtime
This review allow to pass another queue than the tripleo default
one

Change-Id: I7166093cf1a26969425b33f4442f45fa8dc707f0
(cherry picked from commit b3fae6ee1ad4d2b8a18434f2a6d75159ea84b744)

commit_message:
Solving permission errors due to directory ownership on NFS

We do the same work as the GlusterfsBackupDriver, uses chgrp+chmod to set
proper permissions on the directories if needs be.

Change-Id: Ic57c122311039af159c0cfc083e6e9349702d1e4
Closes-Bug: #1715456
(cherry picked from commit dd4c31f527e2c8f93fdfa55fe6713e0e32d94cc9)
(cherry picked from commit 0f3fb16ba3da0fdfc816887aa06920740824bc68)

[{'created': '2018-02-16 06:55:47.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Monitor task of promoting a virtual copy

In case of replicated, bootable or large
volume, promoting a virtual copy takes some time
to promote it. rcopygroup cannot be started when
promoting is still in progress.

This patch will monitor a task of promoting a
virtual copy.

Change-Id: If8a03e6aace393e86fc41ddf69bb724d963954e1
Closes-Bug: #1749642
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Monitor task of promoting a virtual copy

In case of replicated, bootable or large
volume, promoting a virtual copy takes some time
to promote it. rcopygroup cannot be started when
promoting is still in progress.

This patch will monitor a task of promoting a
virtual copy.

Change-Id: If8a03e6aace393e86fc41ddf69bb724d963954e1
Closes-Bug: #1749642

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 11:36:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add major update implementation

Add the openstack overcloud upgrade command and workflow
for major upgrade from P to Queens.
It share the same code base as the minor upgrade but add options
for the converge part and take as parameter a list of
environment files, that could be needed in some cases for the
upgrade init stage. (like repo_setupt)

Change-Id: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f
(cherry picked from commit e62b638acff298fabe63905be398f0c66028a3a2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add major update implementation

Add the openstack overcloud upgrade command and workflow
for major upgrade from P to Queens.
It share the same code base as the minor upgrade but add options
for the converge part and take as parameter a list of
environment files, that could be needed in some cases for the
upgrade init stage. (like repo_setupt)

Change-Id: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f
(cherry picked from commit e62b638acff298fabe63905be398f0c66028a3a2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 14:35:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for libvirt VNC TLS

Configures certs/key for nova-novnc vencrypt when TLS is enabled on the
internal network. A dedicated IPA sub-CA can be used to restrict access,
however by default the main IPA CA is used.

Depends-On: Ic73bcbdbecc1bc05f43acdd5480370f37ead3fb8
Change-Id: I67ffd847dc2d1949833a9d7039ad51e4364e02da
(cherry picked from commit 37a339d2b0f0282bf1bac96587b10ca61868cec5)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for libvirt VNC TLS

Configures certs/key for nova-novnc vencrypt when TLS is enabled on the
internal network. A dedicated IPA sub-CA can be used to restrict access,
however by default the main IPA CA is used.

Depends-On: Ic73bcbdbecc1bc05f43acdd5480370f37ead3fb8
Change-Id: I67ffd847dc2d1949833a9d7039ad51e4364e02da
(cherry picked from commit 37a339d2b0f0282bf1bac96587b10ca61868cec5)

Change-Id: I613b7653c9cb6f8e6f368066c4d881e682d62308

commit_message:
Add a ComputeInstanceHA role

We add a ComputeInstanceHA so that using -e
environments/compute-instanceha.yaml does not require customizing roles
by hand and we can rely on the 'openstack overcloud role generate'
command.

Change-Id: I613b7653c9cb6f8e6f368066c4d881e682d62308
(cherry picked from commit 98925a49cb06371ebc06c030666f24dc9b9aa168)

tripleo.plan_management.v1.list_plans instead of the action
tripleo.plan.action directly.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id257389d8cc82a8863219cbccd805118a10702ab

commit_message:
Use rabbitmq ipv6 flag

The internal details of enabling IPv6 have moved upstream[1], so just
set the ipv6 flag when desired and don't worry about the details
anymore!

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rabbitmq/pull/552

Closes-Bug: #1710658

Change-Id: Ib22507c4d02f0fae5c0189ab7e040efac3df7e2f
(cherry picked from commit 3a5eb08d58e843e50b06309a1d3ff5bb6e42424f)

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Remove k8s-openstack-provider jobs for repo refresh.

k8s-openstack-provider is out of date with external upstream code.
To prepare for the new upstream code to be merged into the repository,
we need to disable the current gate jobs.

Change-Id: I38e2168e311536cc63932d906a46e1b1cf3ac4bf

commit_message:
Move 2 finished specs to corresponding releases

This moves the soft-power-reboot-nmi spec to 7.0 [1] which is when the
feature was finished.

The change-default-api-version-to-latest-known-in-CLI spec was implemented
in the python-ironicclient v2.0.0 [2] which corresponds to the ironic
9.2 version.

This adds a 'Queens' entry to the index, for the 9.2 release.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/ocata.html#id10
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-ironicclient/queens.html#id4

Change-Id: I382aac00fb69ed991b7bafca325ae3b82b985b14

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 17:02:06.000000000', 'message': "Always create containers with fixed MAC addresses

Patch I0d83fd4895d4c5beaf5a84a239c1a1ed71521dee dropped the ARP=yes
option for networkd because it's not supported by old systemd releases.
This however brings back a problem where the default one sysctl
arp_notify option in the kernel may not correctly set for our use case.
Containers are created with random MAC addresses so we need to ensure
that ARP entries are populated correctly when a container is restarted.
Instead of having to implement some sort of a new workaround on the host,
it's probably better to create all containers with fixed MAC addresses from
now on.

Change-Id: I8ad390fc3ce27756f26c57c92aaa3adc8e506a17
"}]
commit_message:
Always create containers with fixed MAC addresses

Patch I0d83fd4895d4c5beaf5a84a239c1a1ed71521dee dropped the ARP=yes
option for networkd because it's not supported by old systemd releases.
This however brings back a problem where the default one sysctl
arp_notify option in the kernel may not correctly set for our use case.
Containers are created with random MAC addresses so we need to ensure
that ARP entries are populated correctly when a container is restarted.
Instead of having to implement some sort of a new workaround on the host,
it's probably better to create all containers with fixed MAC addresses from
now on.

Change-Id: I8ad390fc3ce27756f26c57c92aaa3adc8e506a17

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6d35871757dc864d7fe6fad2fa9e62a9062a7575

commit_message:
py3: Port more CLI tools

Bring under test

 - test/unit/cli/test_dispersion_report.py
 - test/unit/cli/test_info.py and
 - test/unit/cli/test_relinker.py

I've verified that swift-*-info (at least) behave reasonably under
py3, even swift-object-info when there's non-utf8 metadata on the
data/meta file.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I67aa4201151a94afcef8caa4e826d5878db4a96d

commit_message:
Ensure ip_forward set before Docker

Docker will attempt to configure iptables rules if it finds that
ip_forward is not enabled prior to the docker daemon getting started.
We should ensure that this gets configured prior to Docker being
configured if we are configuring it with puppet.

Change-Id: I6ea6fb8ed300d284c961e7474ff84d104f326255
Needed-By: I557e4a41c4e5be3a2f50e5d5ddc86e17c1eb44e1
Related-Bug: #1750194

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Switch submodule urls to relative paths
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 23:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-06 23:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 22:58:20.000000000', 'message': 'Switch submodule urls to relative paths

The absolute urls here makes allows gerrit to track the submodules, but
it makes doing a submodule update harder, since it makes git try to
clone/fetch directly from gerrit instead of the git farm.

According to the gerrit docs:

  https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/user-submodules.html

we can use relative paths. In local testing, the ../.. relative path on
a copy of the repo cloned from git.openstack.org caused a submodule
update to correctly clone from git.openstack.org as well.

Change-Id: I50517d474397c202e7c628b110354832748b6e91
'}]
commit_message:
Switch submodule urls to relative paths

The absolute urls here makes allows gerrit to track the submodules, but
it makes doing a submodule update harder, since it makes git try to
clone/fetch directly from gerrit instead of the git farm.

According to the gerrit docs:

  https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/user-submodules.html

we can use relative paths. In local testing, the ../.. relative path on
a copy of the repo cloned from git.openstack.org caused a submodule
update to correctly clone from git.openstack.org as well.

Change-Id: I50517d474397c202e7c628b110354832748b6e91
