revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 12:58:00.000000000', 'message': "Increase size of Heat HeatMaxJsonBodySize

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat template HeatMaxJsonBodySize default value was 1M and now
it will be 4M. There is aslo corresponding change in instack-undercloud
where we bumped 'max_template_size' to the same value.

Change-Id: I974f6d4adbc08f2960a164b90ebb784ca466e76a
Closes-Bug: 1752467
"}]
commit_message:
Increase size of Heat HeatMaxJsonBodySize

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat template HeatMaxJsonBodySize default value was 1M and now
it will be 4M. There is aslo corresponding change in instack-undercloud
where we bumped 'max_template_size' to the same value.

Change-Id: I974f6d4adbc08f2960a164b90ebb784ca466e76a
Closes-Bug: 1752467

commit_message:
Fix the notification devref location in exception

When the doc structure was changed the location of the notification
devref also changed. This patch updates the reference to this doc in
the AssertionError emited in the test if new legacy notification is
introduced.

In the original review of this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451855/ we decided not to document POST for creating one inventory in favor of PUT to set multiple inventories (PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories) or PUT to set one inventory (PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories/{resource_class} ).

The POST for create is sort of deprecated, and the deprecation thereof predates the existence of any documentation.

But if we want to document it, that's fine, but we should at least say there are better choices."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-23 13:56:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7d389a8aa745a674abc58a7a0eb6157de4349a5c

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Move OpenStack Cloud Controller Manager to project hosting

This patch moves the management of the external Kubernetes
OpenStack Cloud Controller Manager (hosted in GitHub by dims)
to OpenStack, as a sig-k8s managed project.

Change-Id: Ied1230eda1a6675929e29bb860fcc99ba3812f0c

commit_message:
Add a query_string option to head_object().

Submitting a path parameter with a HEAD request on an object can be
useful if one is trying to find out information about an SLO/DLO without
retrieving the manifest.

Change-Id: I39efd098e72bd31de271ac51d4d75381929c9638

I set my tempest test to Depend on this - Passed - 2018-03-01 12:14:04.782357 | primary | {0} tempest.api.compute.volumes.test_attach_volume.AttachVolumeMultiAttachTest.test_multiattach_detach [109.431272s] ... ok'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2018-03-01 18:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21279, 'date': '2018-03-01 18:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

pkvm: recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-03-01 19:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-14712 : SUCCESS in 54m 50s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:43:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Thanks for working on this. I remember talking about counting connections on the same host over the last year or two, but for whatever reason we must have convinced ourselves that we didn't need to do this.

A few issues inline:

1. The new BDMList method is an RPC API change, which we likely won't backport to stable/queens. I've left a suggestion inline on how I think we could do something similar and get the same result.

2. Based on volume type, the connection_info dict is the wild west so we can't assume keys on that thing.

3. Do we need to get so specific that we check the target_iqn? Can't we just count connections for a volume attached to instances on the same host and only disconnect once the last one is gone?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12988, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2018-03-02 22:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2018-03-02 23:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just a refresher, the original idea was to use the attachment_delete response, but that doesn't work because it's required that we remove the connection on the compute node first in case something fails (that was a really big deal starting with conversations in Barcelona).

The next proposal/attempt before this patch was I wanted to query Cinder; however that doesn't work for a couple of reasons:
1. There's no context passed into that _disconnect method (easy enough, get_admin_context)
2. nova_context.get_admin_context() isn't allowed to communicate with the Volume API by policy (change policy but can't backport that either)

So, then I came up with the less than optimal work you see here, BUT since the bdm object currently refuses to deal with more than one BDM for a given volume (quite intentionally), and there's no list method for anything other than instances (or all) I added the much needed list.get_by_volume; BUT yeah, everything is versioned so can't backport RPC version changes so we're sunk there.

So....  there are other things that I can/should obviously fix up here (specificity to iscsi, some of the dict accessors etc) but the bigger question is how does the Nova team want to fix this?  Any recommendations on getting a context in this layer that works?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-03 10:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'created': '2018-02-28 23:40:33.000000000', 'message': "Check for multiattach before removing connections

With the addition of multiattach we need to ensure that we
don't make brick calls to remove connections on detach volume
if that volume is attached to another Instance on the same
node.

This patch adds some logic in the virt driver _disconnect_volume
method to check the BDM's and verify that we don't have any
other attachments using the target requested for removal.

If there are any other attachments detected for that iqn we
skip the brick disconnect call, otherwise we just behave as
normal and remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1752115

Change-Id: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-03 11:18:29.000000000', 'message': "Check for multiattach before removing connections

Closes-Bug: #1752115

Change-Id: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-05 20:19:57.000000000', 'message': "Check for multiattach before removing connections

With the addition of multiattach we need to ensure that we
don't make brick calls to remove connections on detach volume
if that volume is attached to another Instance on the same
node.

This patch adds a new helper method (_should_disconnect_target)
to the virt driver that will inform the caller if the specified
volume is attached multiple times to the current host.

The general strategy for this call is to fetch a current reference
of the specified volume and then:
1. Check if that volume has >1 active attachments
2. Fetch the attachments for the volume and extract the server_uuids
   for each of the attachments.
3. Check the server_uuids against a list of all known server_uuids
   on the current host.  Increment a connection_count for each item
   found.

If the connection_count is >1 we return `False` indicating that the
volume is being used by more than one attachment on the host and
we therefore should NOT destroy the connection.

*NOTE*
This scenario is very different than the `shared_targets`
case (for which we supply a property on the Volume object).  The
`shared_targets` scenario is specifically for Volume backends that
present >1 Volumes using a single Target.  This mechanism is meant
to provide a signal to consumers that locking is required for the
creation and deletion of targets.

Closes-Bug: #1752115

Change-Id: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

commit_message:
Check for multiattach before removing connections

With the addition of multiattach we need to ensure that we
don't make brick calls to remove connections on detach volume
if that volume is attached to another Instance on the same
node.

This patch adds a new helper method (_should_disconnect_target)
to the virt driver that will inform the caller if the specified
volume is attached multiple times to the current host.

The general strategy for this call is to fetch a current reference
of the specified volume and then:
1. Check if that volume has >1 active attachments
2. Fetch the attachments for the volume and extract the server_uuids
   for each of the attachments.
3. Check the server_uuids against a list of all known server_uuids
   on the current host.  Increment a connection_count for each item
   found.

If the connection_count is >1 we return `False` indicating that the
volume is being used by more than one attachment on the host and
we therefore should NOT destroy the connection.

*NOTE*
This scenario is very different than the `shared_targets`
case (for which we supply a property on the Volume object).  The
`shared_targets` scenario is specifically for Volume backends that
present >1 Volumes using a single Target.  This mechanism is meant
to provide a signal to consumers that locking is required for the
creation and deletion of initiator/target sessions.

Closes-Bug: #1752115

Change-Id: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

commit_message:
Pass user context to virt driver when detaching volume

We need this in a later change to pull volume attachment
information from cinder for the volume being detached so
that we can do some attachment counting for multiattach
volumes being detached from instances on the same host.

Change-Id: I751fcb7532679905c4279744919c6cce84a11eb4
Related-Bug: #1752115

commit_message:
Use fetch-javascript-content-tarball role

There is a substantive difference between a content tarball and a source
tarball that was getting missed. Update the docs to indicate what a
'content' tarball is, and then update the
publish-openstack-javascript-content job to use the
fetch-javascript-content-tarball role.

Change-Id: I055ed8248f8243926601c0445ab7c911054fdeb0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550223

subject: Add force flag in cold migration
messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-02-21 03:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-02-21 03:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/enables to bp/add-force-in-cold-migration'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-21 15:13:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am absolutely against this, and we even talked about this in the queens spec to specify a host for cold migration:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/implemented/cold-migration-with-target-queens.html#references

With placement and the need to check things in the scheduler, we definitely shouldn't be bypassing the scheduler at all. I think the force flag for evacuate and live migrate was a bad mistake and we are still dealing with technical debt as a result, so I'm very much opposed to adding that to yet another part of nova."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-02-21 15:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-21 16:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add force flag in cold migration

In the cold migration operation,
the target host is checked by the scheduler
when the target host is specified.
This blueprint enables us to bypass the scheduler check
for the target host in the cold migration operation.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I17c9fbd4ffa2808c3a84c65c94f3c7fbe01c01a3
blueprint add-force-in-cold-migration

subject: [WIP] Add Fast forward upgrade spec
messages:
[{'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16520, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There is a missunderstanding of FFU.
FFU means an offline migration through 1 or more releases.
Rolling-upgrades are online.

Reasoning under FFU is dont have the risk to screw up things during containers or services working in parallel with other versions. Thats the reasing of doing offline.

Treating a rolling-upgrade for multiple versions as a ffu is not proper, still being a rolling upgrade multiple times, but still having the risk of screw up services and databases during the process.

There is a new wiki created during Dublin ptg about FFU, will be adding more information into it.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Fast_forward_upgrades'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-03-03 14:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16520, 'date': '2018-03-06 21:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Use tenacity to retry image pulls

Image pulls often fail due to network or registry load. This change
implements pull retries, up to 4 times with jittered exponential
backoff.

Closes-Bug #1752036

Change-Id: I09c601f357200e734aa9d887c6ce6b4e53fc2589

commit_message:
Remove constantly failing rally jobs from Glance

The legacy rally jobs are constantly failing and no-one clearly has
interest to look into them. Lets stop wasting resources and remove them
from the loop.

Change-Id: I0a4ab0d99af593c232c9d435a0487a6ed671add6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 02:48:58.000000000', 'message': "Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447
"}]
commit_message:
Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447

commit_message:
Adding a note to git setup to use consistent email addresses

This change adds a note to use the same email adress in git config
what was used during account setup.

Also there are corrections to the indentations of notes all over the
guide.

Task: 6563

Change-Id: I96b7c248a3ceffd740e913e945eac57bb3db6801
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:

This patch rehomes the API definition for the dhcpagentscheduler
extension as well as it's corresponding exceptions.A release note
and unit test are also included.

For a sample neutron consumption patch, please see
Depends-On: Icb82b64f50b8b5a32e0863c32be784967afce45e

Change-Id: I50e7616afa18c27571df3e77248e73203d1bf7de

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 14:10:51.000000000', 'message': "Check quota before creating volume snapshots

When creating a snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we
create a snapshot of every volume BDM associated with the
instance. The default volume snapshot limit is 10, so if
you have a volume-backed instance with several volumes attached
and snapshot it a few times, you're likely to fail the
volume snapshot at some point with an OverLimit error from
Cinder. This can lead to orphaned volume snapshots in Cinder
that the user then has to cleanup.

This change makes the snapshot operation a bit more robust by
first checking the quota limit and current usage for the given
project before attempting to create any volume snapshots.

It's not fail-safe since we could still fail with racing snapshot
requests for the same project, but it's a simple improvement to
avoid this issue in the general case.

Change-Id: I4e7b46deb43c0c2430b480f1a498a52fc4a9daf0
Related-Bug: #1731986
(cherry picked from commit 289d2703c75123216d0a6802f2fe5f41aa84407c)
"}]
commit_message:
Check quota before creating volume snapshots

When creating a snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we
create a snapshot of every volume BDM associated with the
instance. The default volume snapshot limit is 10, so if
you have a volume-backed instance with several volumes attached
and snapshot it a few times, you're likely to fail the
volume snapshot at some point with an OverLimit error from
Cinder. This can lead to orphaned volume snapshots in Cinder
that the user then has to cleanup.

This change makes the snapshot operation a bit more robust by
first checking the quota limit and current usage for the given
project before attempting to create any volume snapshots.

It's not fail-safe since we could still fail with racing snapshot
requests for the same project, but it's a simple improvement to
avoid this issue in the general case.

Change-Id: I4e7b46deb43c0c2430b480f1a498a52fc4a9daf0
Related-Bug: #1731986
(cherry picked from commit 289d2703c75123216d0a6802f2fe5f41aa84407c)

Remove version-from-git role from release playbook

There's a ton of complexity that's not needed, since the fetch role now
just keys off of zuul.tag.

commit_message:
Add swift probe tests to gate

This patch includes some generic playbooks to configure a SAIO[0]
plus the playbook to run the probe tests.

The current SAIO playbooks have only been tests on CentOS, they
would need additional changes to run on Ubuntu.

[0] - https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/development_saio.html

Change-Id: Ib72c77021aeed20f2070d42cff0ea9b671a4317a

commit_message:
Install and enable neutron baremetal ML2 and L2 agent

Ironic use binding:vnic_type baremetal for flat interfaces.
The baremetal mechanism driver is required to bind this
vnic_type correctly.

The L2 agent populates segmenthostmapping data in neutron
which is a requirement for routed-networks.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: I8e192df9068c3f5d6657f5ea92e7e2f44646c290

Due to bz#1520534, restarting iptables may cause unrelated kernel
modules to be unloaded. In order to not trigger this condition we should
reload iptables from the configuration rather than restart the whole
process.

Change-Id: Ifc625eb51f6cc2a0a4cf4f83ac7a4978db641d75
Closes-Bug: #1752441

commit_message:
Reload iptables instead of restart

Due to bz#1520534, restarting iptables may cause unrelated kernel
modules to be unloaded. In order to not trigger this condition we should
reload iptables from the configuration rather than restart the whole
process.

Change-Id: Ifc625eb51f6cc2a0a4cf4f83ac7a4978db641d75
Closes-Bug: #1752441
Closes-Bug: #1753492
(cherry picked from commit bb5013920ac658c99d9ae2ab7f81847b274aa177)

[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-11-06 21:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

please give more info about this change'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-11-07 12:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Without using remote_src the task expects the generated certificate on the local system. Which is not there when running the task against a remote system. The certificate will be generated on the target system and not on the local system. At the moment the task only works when the host is localhost. Which is probably the case in most cases. But I have at least on customer environment where I want to use this playbook to generated the certificate on a target != localhost.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18368, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 19:38:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix races in conditionals tests

In convergence, resources have a tendency to appear and disappear in their
own time, not atomically with a change to the stack state. Therefore when
testing conditionals (i.e. looking for resources to appear/disappear) we
must be careful to take into account the states of the resources we find to
avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I488921c6c4c3324912ded494db5ab9605becce9b
Closes-Bug: #1737796
(cherry picked from commit e1f4d7fca269c468f27934d373c815e4b75ab63f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix races in conditionals tests

In convergence, resources have a tendency to appear and disappear in their
own time, not atomically with a change to the stack state. Therefore when
testing conditionals (i.e. looking for resources to appear/disappear) we
must be careful to take into account the states of the resources we find to
avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I488921c6c4c3324912ded494db5ab9605becce9b
Closes-Bug: #1737796
(cherry picked from commit e1f4d7fca269c468f27934d373c815e4b75ab63f)

commit_message:
Cleanup Newton Release Notes

This adds the earliest-version directive to only show the Newton release
which was 7.0.0.
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/heat/newton.html

Also, do not generate an index file, it is empty, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/heat/genindex.html

Change-Id: I3d61e8a11a6a4e62d098fb85d8269c79434cd027

commit_message:
DNM refactor zuul job definitions

we have a matrix of auto-converted jobs that are very similar
in terms of playbooks due to simple expansion of old jenkis job
builder templates executed during auto-conversion.

This patch tries to refactor those back to fewer parametrized jobs.

For now, all auto-converted jobs are disabled for faster testing.

Change-Id: Ib1b47946dc45214ef533e9ec3189fb07542d6ecc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21279, 'name': 'Patricia Domingues', 'email': 'patricia.domingues@canonical.com', 'username': 'patriciasd'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-02-26 16:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-27 04:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not totally opposed to this, but by this point, devstack, tempest and whatever else has all finished, so this is a snapshot of whatever happens to be left-over; it's quite conceivable things have shutdown etc and the system is in a rather undefined state.

We have things like the peakmem tracker and worlddump.  What are you looking for?  Maybe we can find a way to enhance things in a more defined manner"}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-02-28 10:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have not needed it myself too (contrary to pip-freeze files).

I just found this while I compared artifacts collected by the legacy, devstack-gate based, jobs and the native ones. Not sure of how is this a legacy crust, thus proposed to have it.

It is being generated by devstack-gate, and exactly around the time when both pip-freeze, dpkg -l and others are collected as well [0], so I though adding it for feature parity would be nice.

[0] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh#n916'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-02-28 10:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-02-28 13:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-01 03:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It just seems a bit like a really undefined thing; how would anybody know what's in there unless they pulled apart the job and figured out the point it was called, and it's not clear what would be looked for.

I don't want to argue over a trivial one line patch :)  There's already so many logs new dev's find it really hard to find the needles in the haystack ... for mine I'd prefer if we add things we put things in a more structured form however (for example; timestamps are pretty important for cross-log analysis)"}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-03-01 07:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-03-01 16:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 21279, 'date': '2018-03-01 19:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

pkvm: recheck'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-03-02 06:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-03-05 12:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I tend to agree with Ian here, we do not need feature parity for features that have no real use. So unless there is a convincing reason to continue having this, getting rid of it seems fine.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-06 18:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

do not really need it for now (just aimed for parity with old devstack-gate jobs artifact-wise)'}]

commit_message:
Collect list of processes thru ps

In order to collect the same artifacts as devstack-gate-based legacy
jobs do, also collect a snapshot of running processes collected thru 'ps'.

Change-Id: Ie76595c0223d83ea47cda264104264e88a1328ae

commit_message:
Move in playbook and variables

The os_aodh role is being transitioned out of the OSA integraded repo.
This commit moves the playbooks and variables related to aodh
from the integrated repo into the role repository under the 'extras'
directory.

Change-Id: I5a5fafb09d4774f3f34db7307c047cd51581e5e9
Depends-On: I7bfa5d1a786ab68560783d7ac662fec6c7848c93

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to

commit_message:
Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d
(cherry picked from commit 92f78fe4387b1cfc1a055b12b2db73c41188aecf)

commit_message:
zuul: Add missing CentOS and openSUSE jobs

openSUSE and CentOS have been voting jobs for a while so we should
start testing all the scenarios on them. The only job that hasn't
been added is the ZFS one since there is no such package on openSUSE
or CentOS.

Change-Id: I25e79a1fab85f1bb4b88f8f7a8eaf945e68ef0ba
Depends-On: Icde5ed7a4e6be8ac19412f15b84febf2096ba404

[{'created': '2016-07-14 11:44:27.000000000', 'message': "Add more validation for outputs

There are 3 steps where functions are validated:
1)function.__init__()
2)function.validate()
3)function.resolve()
This adds function.resolve() for output snippets.
We should resolve only that functions that are resolvable
in parse time, otherwise validation step can fail, because
functions check arguments in result() method and doesn't
expect None values, that are returned in the case where resource
is in INIT state. This should make outputs validation invulnerable
to bug 1559807.
Specific UnresolvedFunctionException returned
when function can't be resolved and handled during validation.

Partial-bug: #1599114

Change-Id: Ib24deaa100f2fe3a74f0cfbba681856af669d675

commit_message:
Add more validation for outputs

There are 3 steps where functions are validated:
1)function.__init__()
2)function.validate()
3)function.resolve()
This adds function.resolve() for output snippets.
We should resolve only that functions that are resolvable
in parse time, otherwise validation step can fail, because
functions check arguments in result() method and doesn't
expect None values, that are returned in the case where resource
is in INIT state. This should make outputs validation invulnerable
to bug 1559807.
Specific UnresolvedFunctionException returned
when function can't be resolved and handled during validation.

Partial-bug: #1599114

Change-Id: Ib24deaa100f2fe3a74f0cfbba681856af669d675

commit_message:
tests: Use domain names for external network testing

We should use domain names for the external network testing task in
order to verify no only that the default gateway works properly but also
that our DNS is able to resolve hostnames.

Change-Id: I3aebcf1dff8268e4dbaebae8fb598ee27e3f481d

commit_message:
Enable more extensions in pep8

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I9ad51e006561251030b5a6759c930b87ff94a861

Update to fedora-27 for testing

We (openstack-infra) are in the process of removing fedora-26 from our
testing infrastructure. Update testing to use fedora-27 nodes.

subject: Use static MAC by default
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-06 17:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nabandoning for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550160/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 15:35:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use static MAC by default

The option to enable or disable static mac addresses by default has
existed for a while but we only enable this selectively. This change
makes static mac address generation on container creation the default.
This change is being done to simplify the container network setup which
is now all using systemd-networkd. While systemd-networkd does support
an ARP option which will send grat arps, it is not universally available
given the operating systems we support. By setting the mac address
statically the need for a grat arp is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I4b5d7ca5a452a1497fd861ca52cbb9e2a0b507a3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use static MAC by default

The option to enable or disable static mac addresses by default has
existed for a while but we only enable this selectively. This change
makes static mac address generation on container creation the default.
This change is being done to simplify the container network setup which
is now all using systemd-networkd. While systemd-networkd does support
an ARP option which will send grat arps, it is not universally available
given the operating systems we support. By setting the mac address
statically the need for a grat arp is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I4b5d7ca5a452a1497fd861ca52cbb9e2a0b507a3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-06 09:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-06 10:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This in isolation may be OK, but I think we still need to instrument an ARP flush when the interface comes up because LXC may use a new MAC address. We had this implemented before switching to systemd-networking: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/blob/stable/queens/vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml#L29-L33'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-06 12:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> This in isolation may be OK, but I think we still need to
 > instrument an ARP flush when the interface comes up because LXC may
 > use a new MAC address. We had this implemented before switching to
 > systemd-networking: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/blob/stable/queens/vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml#L29-L33

The new code has this

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L158

Maybe we should turn this on by default so we don't have to care about MAC addresses and ARPs anymore?"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-06 12:25:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yeah, that was implemented for certain containers which *need* a fixed MAC (rabbitmq, mariadb, neutron agents). Perhaps it'd be simpler to just assume we want fixed MAC addresses and take out the condition."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I would agree with Jesse, I think all containers should have a fixed MAC and it would be simpler to just enable the fixed MAC by default.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I would agree with Jesse, I think all containers should have a
 > fixed MAC and it would be simpler to just enable the fixed MAC by
 > default.

ok sounds good to me. we can do that in a new patch.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
templates: networkd: Drop Link=ARP from networkd configuration

The ARP option has been added in systemd-232. As such, current stable
distributions may not support it so drop the option and let the kernel
decide what to do with ARP. Fixes the following warning:

[/etc/systemd/network/eth0.network:14] Unknown lvalue 'ARP' in section 'Link'

Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/3854
Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/99d2baa2cab0706d89beff596f997d4e3a1c833f
Depends-On: I14f8373897da28dea2ea03500c2be46c5b40d51c
Change-Id: I0d83fd4895d4c5beaf5a84a239c1a1ed71521dee

commit_message:
Filter traces that contain error/exception

Adds ability to filter error traces to OSProfiler.
Adds command for list error traces.

Change-Id: I0ec97337cae5e573fedae2b6665aa73a73fe3654

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The encrypted volume LM failures are due to the following UCA specific issue with their build of libvirt 2.5.0:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libvirt/+bug/1744758

This must be a recent regression as the creation of `luks` secrets has previously worked fine in the gate.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-01-22 19:02:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The encrypted volume LM failures are due to the following UCA
 > specific issue with their build of libvirt 2.5.0:
 > 
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libvirt/+bug/1744758
 > 
 > This must be a recent regression as the creation of `luks` secrets
 > has previously worked fine in the gate.

Correction, the encrypted volume failures on the grenade job are due to our use of some broken Xenial Libvirt 2.5.0 packages covered by the above bug. That job doesn't use the UCA, while the other LM job does, thus the lack of encrypted volume failures there."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-01-22 19:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 12:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test LM with encrypted volumes

This is a cherry-pick of Id9c62fdb24cd09bafd5ffca2cc6ff4cf69685f87
stacked on top of bp/libvirt-qemu-native-luks to enable testing.

I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca is used to hardcode fixed_key
across all hosts in this multi-host deployment.

Ibd24602c1948e55b016573e3a0b756a2fc05dc35 introduces the actual tempest
test, attaching an encrypted volume to an volume backed instance and
attempting to LM.

Depends-On: I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca
Depends-On: Ibd24602c1948e55b016573e3a0b756a2fc05dc35
Change-Id: Ie0b188d0dac50b8ad2287ad86774fbd63a644b57
'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 11:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test LM with encrypted volumes

This is a cherry-pick of Id9c62fdb24cd09bafd5ffca2cc6ff4cf69685f87
stacked on top of bp/libvirt-qemu-native-luks to enable testing.

I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca is used to hardcode fixed_key
across all hosts in this multi-host deployment.

Ibd24602c1948e55b016573e3a0b756a2fc05dc35 introduces the actual tempest
test, attaching an encrypted volume to an volume backed instance and
attempting to LM.

Depends-On: I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca
Depends-On: Ibd24602c1948e55b016573e3a0b756a2fc05dc35
Change-Id: Ie0b188d0dac50b8ad2287ad86774fbd63a644b57
'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 12:51:21.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test LM with encrypted volumes

This is a cherry-pick of Id9c62fdb24cd09bafd5ffca2cc6ff4cf69685f87
stacked on top of bp/libvirt-qemu-native-luks to enable testing.

Depends-On: I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca

This is used to hardcode fixed_key across all hosts in this multi-host
deployment.

Depends-On: Ibd24602c1948e55b016573e3a0b756a2fc05dc35

This change introduces the actual tempest test, attaching an encrypted
volume to an volume backed instance and attempting to LM.

Depends-On: I4d5fa052bdc5eef1795f6507589e2eaf4e093e23

This enables the pike UCA during grenade testing, required to avoid:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1744758/

Change-Id: Ie0b188d0dac50b8ad2287ad86774fbd63a644b57
'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 10:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test LM with encrypted volumes

Depends-On: Id9c62fdb24cd09bafd5ffca2cc6ff4cf69685f87

Enables test_volume_backed_live_migration in Tempest.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 09:13:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add resource_class to fields in ironic node cache

Per the discussion in [1], the ironic nodes added to the node cache in
the ironic virt driver may be missing the required field resource_class,
as this field is not in _NODE_FIELDS. In practice, this is typically
not an issue (possibly never), as the normal code path uses a
detailed list to sync all ironic nodes, which contain all fields
(including resource_class). However, some code paths use a single
node query with the fields limited to _NODE_FIELDS, so could result in a
node in the cache without a resource_class.

This change adds resource_class to _NODE_FIELDS.

[1]
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532288/9/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py@79

Change-Id: Id84b4a47d05532d341a9b6ca2de7e9e66e1930da
Closes-Bug: #1746209
(cherry picked from commit 5895566a428be4c30c31ae94070282566a6cc568)
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource_class to fields in ironic node cache

Per the discussion in [1], the ironic nodes added to the node cache in
the ironic virt driver may be missing the required field resource_class,
as this field is not in _NODE_FIELDS. In practice, this is typically
not an issue (possibly never), as the normal code path uses a
detailed list to sync all ironic nodes, which contain all fields
(including resource_class). However, some code paths use a single
node query with the fields limited to _NODE_FIELDS, so could result in a
node in the cache without a resource_class.

This change adds resource_class to _NODE_FIELDS.

[1]
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532288/9/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py@79

Change-Id: Id84b4a47d05532d341a9b6ca2de7e9e66e1930da
Closes-Bug: #1746209
(cherry picked from commit 5895566a428be4c30c31ae94070282566a6cc568)

[{'created': '2018-03-05 16:17:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove deprecated_nic_config_name from default role data

Providing deprecated_nic_config_name only makes sense when users have
their own nic configs to reference. Using it in the default
roles_data.yaml is counterproductive, because it breaks deployment
when using the provided networking environments in `environments` dir
of t-h-t by referencing files that don't exist in the plan (the
autogenerated files are named based on the role names).

Closes-Bug: #1752808
Change-Id: Id9017393ae150fbd3bbbf4985d579b62d0162d77
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated_nic_config_name from default role data

Providing deprecated_nic_config_name only makes sense when users have
their own nic configs to reference. Using it in the default
roles_data.yaml is counterproductive, because it breaks deployment
when using the provided networking environments in `environments` dir
of t-h-t by referencing files that don't exist in the plan (the
autogenerated files are named based on the role names).

Closes-Bug: #1752808
Change-Id: Id9017393ae150fbd3bbbf4985d579b62d0162d77

commit_message:
Base: Add trusted option to apt mirrors

Since our Debian+Ubuntu mirrors are unsigned, we need to set the
"trusted" option on them in order to allow newer apt versions to pull
updates from them.

Logs of testing can be found at https://review.openstack.org/549867/

Change-Id: Ib847b953d4f8255ac4967889e83325e015516cb8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

In the command example we can see the "Before" is running 10 commands
to run a single command task while the "After" is running only 6.

commit_message:
Reduce interactions by nearly 50%

The container interactions require a couple interactions to address the
container namespace as well as pad the pathing when transmitting a file.
This change reduces those interactions by nearly half for a single task
by storing information about a target container instead of looking it up
for every interaction.

Example file transfer:
  > Before this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691341/
  > After this PR: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691338/

In the example we can see the "Before" runnins 20 commands to transfer
a file to a target while the "After" is running only 11.

Example command:
  > Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691343/
  > After: http://paste.openstack.org/show/691344/

In the command example we can see the "Before" is running 10 commands
to run a single command task while the "After" is running only 6.

This change will improve general ansible performance by cutting down the
number of operations needed to be completed to execute any one task.

Change-Id: Ia8405ec5c3b55ed3f7f134c4882d337c5e0b625f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix request return resp not exist 'action' key

This patch fix API version control requests failed,
print message error. The request cannot succeed when
the version of the request API operation has a special
request. Look:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/
api/openstack/v1/clusters.py#L123

And fix ResizeCluster max-complexity limit error.

Change-Id: Ieb474ee576e838843b8c03a692d7c09e594975b6
Closes-Bug: #1753747

commit_message:
[openstack] Remove nova hosts specific logic

os-hosts CLIs and python API bindings had been deprecated from
python-novaclient 9.0.0 and finally became removed in 10.0.0 release.

The related scenarios become redundant. We cannot launch then in gates
and it is impossible to ensure that they work even with old novaclient
release. Since it is not something critical and what is called regulary
in old OpenStack environments we should not provide any workaround and
can just remove the os-hosts logic from Rally.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-hosts-d08855550c40b9c6.yaml

Change-Id: I915983dbc634dafcab1cc54dba7bae8d4e368884

commit_message:
Use net-config-undercloud.yaml from THT

... instead of net-config-simple-bridge.yaml, which has no
proper MTU support and is NOT undercloud cases specific.

The net-config-undercloud.yaml is adapted to maintain features
parity with the net-config-simple-bridge.yaml in dependency
patches.

Change-Id: I36bd1bd07be9459d223017b9bf6ce4451ed92ef5
Related-Bug: #1753406
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
SUSE: Use the lxcbr0 IP as the initial DNS resolver

The role prepares and runs a dnsmasq server on the lxcbr0 interface so
we should be able to use that as the default DNS server for the
containers.

Change-Id: Ic8342a53d6f0f54e3dadcd2a7075af0ac32336be

* Remove nameserver-records config option this option was recently
  introduced and is not in stable and it duplicates the existing
  nameservers config option.
* Create Queens+ charm class so that sink configs can be removed
  as these are no longer needed. Rendering sink configs also causes

commit_message:
Queens Fixes

* Remove nameserver-records config option this option was recently
  introduced and is not in stable and it duplicates the existing
  nameservers config option.
* Create Queens+ charm class so that sink configs can be removed
  as these are no longer needed. Rendering sink configs also causes
  the designate api service to be called and hence Bug #1753420
* Add custom_assess_status_check for Queens+ as the nameservers
  config option is compulsory.

Change-Id: Ib9ac66afa898aadb3adbc617f2a5dacb78fe0ab7

commit_message:
Fix creds for keystone v3 deploys with designate

The charm was using keystone v2 creds to attempt to authenticate
with keystone despite keystone using v3.

Change-Id: Ib815fa5d77949e6cd6e79cd9fa9a088e5f6ae394

commit_message:
Add the ability to get absolute limits from Cinder

This will be used in a later patch to check quota usage
for volume snapshots before attempting to create new
volume snapshots, so we can avoid an OverLimit error.

Change-Id: Ica7c087708e86494d285fc3905a5740fd1356e5f
Related-Bug: #1731986
(cherry picked from commit ad389244ba5737d01f0c28e6704fc93b83dace9e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 19:31:54.000000000', 'message': 'unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

This patch adds an exception catch to "snapshot_volume_backed()" of
compute/api.py that catches (at the moment) _all_ exceptions from the
underlying cinderclient. Previously, if the instance is quiesced ( frozen
filesystem ) then the exception will break execution of the function,
skipping the needed unquiesce, and leave the instance in a frozen state.

Now, the exception catch will unquiesce the instance if it was prior to
the failure.

Got a unit test in place with the help of Matt Riedemann.
    test_snapshot_volume_backed_with_quiesce_create_snap_fails

Change-Id: I60de179c72eede6746696f29462ee9d805dace47
Closes-bug: #1731986
(cherry picked from commit bca425a33f52584051348a3ace832be8151299a7)
'}]
commit_message:
unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

This patch adds an exception catch to "snapshot_volume_backed()" of
compute/api.py that catches (at the moment) _all_ exceptions from the
underlying cinderclient. Previously, if the instance is quiesced ( frozen
filesystem ) then the exception will break execution of the function,
skipping the needed unquiesce, and leave the instance in a frozen state.

Now, the exception catch will unquiesce the instance if it was prior to
the failure.

Got a unit test in place with the help of Matt Riedemann.
    test_snapshot_volume_backed_with_quiesce_create_snap_fails

Change-Id: I60de179c72eede6746696f29462ee9d805dace47
Closes-bug: #1731986
(cherry picked from commit bca425a33f52584051348a3ace832be8151299a7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 14:57:10.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-02-22 07:36:38.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ce531dd1b763704b9043ddde8e80ac99cd193660)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ce531dd1b763704b9043ddde8e80ac99cd193660)

[{'created': '2018-03-06 14:09:17.000000000', 'message': 'cni: _has_cap unit tests system independant

Originally the test was designed so that it would use the system CapBnd.
This was good because it would alert us soon if the procfs status
formatting changed. This however presents issues with severely
constrained environments like the one in the bug description.

Change-Id: Ie95d6cb35d9bee5c62e09a272001c68bb684ee73
Closes-Bug: 1753751
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
cni: _has_cap unit tests system independant

Originally the test was designed so that it would use the system CapBnd.
This was good because it would alert us soon if the procfs status
formatting changed. This however presents issues with severely
constrained environments like the one in the bug description.

Change-Id: Ie95d6cb35d9bee5c62e09a272001c68bb684ee73
Closes-Bug: 1753751
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
[placement] Add functional tests for traits API

Add functional tests for traits API in the following cases.

* Invalid 'resource_provider_generation' in
  PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/traits
* Invalid 'traits' in
  PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/traits
* Additional properties in
  PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/traits
* Earlier microverion (1.5)

Fix a response string to check in the following test.

* Missing 'resource_provider_generation' in

commit_message:
Update noVNC deployment docs to mention non-US keymap fix in 1.0.0

noVNC 1.0.0 has the fix for non-US key mappings so this adds a simple
note when installing the novnc package that at least 1.0.0 should be
used for non-US key map support.

Change-Id: Ia1a84c986025f8a46c1062440faa0deb1d2d73a5
Related-Bug: #1682020
(cherry picked from commit ed7af4c8f4d72ed0a1c15daf1c700b07fbeed635)

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in put (3)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.
When removing a resource provider from an instance allocation
and putting allocations to a resource provider,
the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Conflicts:
    nova/scheduler/client/report.py

NOTE(takashin): The conflict is due to
I2563213dc3b184049af336f0807c4cb4690a9f9a is not backported.

Change-Id: I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717
Partial-Bug: #1734625
(cherry picked from commit f66bd7369a86b1833cd146de67c4337ea150f087)

This framework relies on Java implementation of persister. Please make a distinct note about it.

Do you plan on extending this for Python as well?

Another question: The test measures the number of messages flushed by persister and not actually saved in the DB. Isn't that inaccurate?"}, {'account_id': 24580, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24580, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Added note that it currently supports Java Perister only. The framework applies to Python as well, but unlike the Java persister, the Monasca python persister does not have api to expose such metrics as messages and flushes. Future work is needed for the Python impl. I plan to add more work to the Python persister in the bear future.
The flushed metric is accurate. The Cassandra persister uses the synchronous query execution, so flushed is a good indication that the metric is saved in db.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 23:09:28.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add performance testing in Monasca persister

Leverages the JMeter and KafkaMeter to inject into persister metric
messages with permutation of random metric names and dimensions.
Monitors the metrics flushed to the database in all persister
instances and calculates the throughput. The number of metrics and
the number of unique metic definitions are configurable in the test
plan.

Change-Id: Id8e6a5b62aa434d9943c7eee4be8991536b1c45f

commit_message:
Add performance testing in Monasca persister

Leverages the JMeter and KafkaMeter to inject into persister metric
messages with permutation of random metric names and dimensions.
Monitors the metrics flushed to the database in all persister
instances and calculates the throughput. The number of metrics and
the number of unique metic definitions are configurable in the test
plan. The script currently supports only the Java implementation of
the Monasca persister. Monasca python does not provide the same
internal metric api as the Dropwizard in the Java implemation.
Future work is required for the Python implemation.

Change-Id: Id8e6a5b62aa434d9943c7eee4be8991536b1c45f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543399

task: 5841

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 00:49:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add a note on experimental jobs

With I4161e1f1c8d47070dd35fad38b00715438d94eb2 and
I37fe007dc6f387d43cbaf55771027718005ac40d we have removed most of the
legacy experimental jobs.

Add a short note so we don't go back to the Hotel California model of
"you can check in but never check out".  With zuulv3 it is possible to
have self-testing changes for testing indiviual jobs.  Experimental
should be for things with wider application to run against all
changes.

Change-Id: Ibfb902b17a8f7d5355689f2a584c061c001df0d8
'}]
commit_message:
Add a note on experimental jobs

With I4161e1f1c8d47070dd35fad38b00715438d94eb2 and
I37fe007dc6f387d43cbaf55771027718005ac40d we have removed most of the
legacy experimental jobs.

Add a short note so we don't go back to the Hotel California model of
"you can check in but never check out".  With zuulv3 it is possible to
have self-testing changes for testing indiviual jobs.  Experimental
should be for things with wider application to run against all
changes.

Change-Id: Ibfb902b17a8f7d5355689f2a584c061c001df0d8

commit_message:
Glance: use endpoints section and lookups to set port

This PS moves glance to use the endpoints section and lookups to
set the port it serves on.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 22:09:06.000000000', 'message': "Handle spawning error on unshelving

If spawning fails when unshelving, terminate the volumes' connections
with the node, and remove the node reference from the instance entry.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1627694

commit_message:
Handle spawning error on unshelving

If spawning fails when unshelving, terminate the volumes' connections
with the node, and remove the node reference from the instance entry.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1627694
Change-Id: I8cfb2280d956d452ccad1fc711bd814b7258147f
(cherry picked from commit dcdd2c9832c7c60fe9163cd744ca2b5acfe16bcc)

api-ref, bgpvpn API extension: update status

where in development for the Queens release.

This change updates these notes.

commit_message:
Run logs collection after job finished in RDO CI

we run logs collection in post playbook in upstream infra CI,
do the same in third-party CI whith OVB and multinode jobs.
Collect logs fter job is finished.

Depends on https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/12442/
Change-Id: I4c2ec1847a47bda6a30e5045b04b750e91b1ebda

commit_message:
templates: networkd: UseDNS requires systemd-resolved

The UseDNS option requires the systemd-resolved service so set this
option based on the lxc_container_enable_resolved variable.

Change-Id: I5b7c3f01534f5ccbaf76aced673aefc6ec7fcf6e

commit_message:
Render certs for all endpoint types

When using user supplied certs directly to the charms make sure
that the bundles which are passed in are rendered for all
supported endpoint types (internal, admin and public).

Closes-Bug: #1750915
Change-Id: If62fd5528470653586b2be3aaef7f829e5abad40

[{'created': '2018-03-06 09:47:17.000000000', 'message': "SUSE: Do not wipe DNS resolver entries from base image

SUSE lacks the systemd-resolved support, so it's not possible to pull
DNS options from the DHCP server or even hardcoding them in the .network
files. The only alternative is to manage the DNS servers in the base
image

Change-Id: I316c3851f40f08d272b7bb5f7165e010e3a95c3a
Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1084080
"}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Do not wipe DNS resolver entries from base image

SUSE lacks the systemd-resolved support, so it's not possible to pull
DNS options from the DHCP server or even hardcoding them in the .network
files. The only alternative is to manage the DNS servers in the base
image

Change-Id: I316c3851f40f08d272b7bb5f7165e010e3a95c3a
Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1084080

subject: Added license informaton for third-party libraries
messages:
[{'account_id': 27836, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27836, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:45:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Looks good. I'm wondering if we want to add short note about finding the generated output of this plugin in the README's license section [1]?

commit_message:
templates: lxc-system-manage: Send correct DNS over dhcp

We should set the correct DNS IP address via DHCP so containers can get
a valid entry. This fixes a problem where the DNS inherits the DNS
server from the host and the host uses the localhost IP in case it's
running a local DNS caching resolver such as dnsmasq.

Depends-On: Ied7632037f737c3f32c34dac70531065c54496c9
Change-Id: I14f8373897da28dea2ea03500c2be46c5b40d51c

commit_message:
Change controller ulimit to match the default

The default limit for file descriptors is 1024 so this validations
would fail when run with the default settings.

Change-Id: I7053ea0f56fa620ddccc8dcbc31f6cc98249abc1
(cherry picked from commit 935fd1ff76fd2d8e971a737f3463f5b60c5a0190)

commit_message:
Update the README

This updates the README. Following work has been done:

* Indent some lines (there is a rendering issue on github)

* Remove the "Edit entry_points.txt" step. (This file doesn't exist anymore
  in any of Ceilometer's upstream branches.)

* Update some parts of "Edit setup.cfg" step: the 'ceilometer.publisher' section
  doesn't exist anymore.

* Remove 'storage/impl_monasca.py' from files to copy step

* Add opts.py and monasca_ceilometer_opts.py to copy step

* Wrap lines > 80 chars

* Made relevant files a bullet list

* Update branch from stable/liberty to stable/pike

Change-Id: I77820547df9cc1514896f56a567db779ed00e1f8

subject: Allow unicode for metadata keys in publisher
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 16:13:02.000000000', 'message': 'Allow unicode for metadata keys in publisher

I encountered a bug whith the following configuration in
monasca_field_definitions.yaml:

  metadata:
    cpu:
        - flavor_id: flavor["id"]
        - flavor_name: flavor["name"]

The problem was in _get_value_metadata_for_key(): sometimes keys
from ceilometer samples can be unicode.

Change-Id: I8914c2238f3a450393f07e6309f57451c8c45cf2
'}]
commit_message:
Allow unicode for metadata keys in publisher

I encountered a bug whith the following configuration in
monasca_field_definitions.yaml:

  metadata:
    cpu:
        - flavor_id: flavor["id"]
        - flavor_name: flavor["name"]

The problem was in _get_value_metadata_for_key(): sometimes keys
from ceilometer samples can be unicode.

Change-Id: I8914c2238f3a450393f07e6309f57451c8c45cf2

commit_message:
Implement always tag for required fact

The fact set for 'Set image index fact' is used
in the next task, which is tagged 'always' but
the fact setting is not. This breaks when using
tags.

Given that all the tasks in this file are set to
'always', this patch moves the tag setting to
the inclusion instead.

Change-Id: If319e749ef7cdfbbbd3d03096608fc736927f89d
(cherry picked from commit 92f78fe4387b1cfc1a055b12b2db73c41188aecf)

Set network-feature-enabled.port_security to True

tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_snapshots.VolumesSnapshotTestJSON.
test_snapshot_create_offline_delete needs port_security feature.
In tempest, It is disabled by default.
We need to enable in order to run this tests and this test is default
in another featureset from Queens. So enabling this params for the
same.

messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-05 18:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-06 10:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-03-06 14:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 18:10:14.000000000', 'message': "Document possible effects of etcd compaction

etcd compaction potentially affects calls where we are specifying a
particular etcd revision, but that etcd revision is no longer available
because of etcd compaction.  In networking-calico that means watch(),
put() and delete() calls with a specific mod_revision.  In each case the
window for compaction to make itself felt is relatively small -
basically, between when networking-calico reads some data, that has a
particular revision, and when it then decides to delete or update that,
or to start watching for further changes from that revision.  But the
window still exists.

- For watch(), compaction can cause a watch() call to silently fail; but
  we timeout each watch() call after 10s anyway, so that is OK.  This is
  documented in more detail next to the watch_subtree() call in
  etcdutils.py.

- For put() and delete(), experimentation indicates that compaction does
  not affect the correctness of put/delete calls with a specified
  mod_revision: regardless of compaction, they succeed if there has not
  been another change to the key since that revision, and fail if there
  has.  So there is nothing extra that we need to do in the
  networking-calico code here.

In addition, one might worry about compaction affecting an existing
watch() - i.e. where etcd is compacted after a client has already
started watching a key range from some revision.  But in fact there is
no impact here, because:

- if the keys being watched are changed before the compaction, etcd
  reports events for those keys (as usual) before the compaction

- at the compaction, the key value isn't actually changing, so there is
  no event

- if the keys change after the compaction, etcd reports events for those
  changes as usual.

To put it another way, compaction after a watch has started does not
impact the completeness of the information that etcd is able to tell us
about the watched key range.

Change-Id: I93faf7bdb5fd866629e58d7cc144cfc317fb16de
"}]
commit_message:
Document possible effects of etcd compaction

etcd compaction potentially affects calls where we are specifying a
particular etcd revision, but that etcd revision is no longer available
because of etcd compaction.  In networking-calico that means watch(),
put() and delete() calls with a specific mod_revision.  In each case the
window for compaction to make itself felt is relatively small -
basically, between when networking-calico reads some data, that has a
particular revision, and when it then decides to delete or update that,
or to start watching for further changes from that revision.  But the
window still exists.

- For watch(), compaction can cause a watch() call to silently fail; but
  we timeout each watch() call after 10s anyway, so that is OK.  This is
  documented in more detail next to the watch_subtree() call in
  etcdutils.py.

- For put() and delete(), experimentation indicates that compaction does
  not affect the correctness of put/delete calls with a specified
  mod_revision: regardless of compaction, they succeed if there has not
  been another change to the key since that revision, and fail if there
  has.  So there is nothing extra that we need to do in the
  networking-calico code here.

In addition, one might worry about compaction affecting an existing
watch() - i.e. where etcd is compacted after a client has already
started watching a key range from some revision.  But in fact there is
no impact here, because:

- if the keys being watched are changed before the compaction, etcd
  reports events for those keys (as usual) before the compaction

- at the compaction, the key value isn't actually changing, so there is
  no event

- if the keys change after the compaction, etcd reports events for those
  changes as usual.

To put it another way, compaction after a watch has started does not
impact the completeness of the information that etcd is able to tell us
about the watched key range.

Change-Id: I93faf7bdb5fd866629e58d7cc144cfc317fb16de

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 10:23:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Add setup-networking role for multinode jobs

Multinode jobs need a mechanism for nodes to communicate to each
other so that they can support running a cloud with Neutron
networking.

Adding a setup-networking role that produces the same results as
the homonymous function in devstack-gate, and it includes most
of the code from the ovs-* roles in d-g.

Change-Id: I0f9381816ca775dd5ca0fb9153226f70201dd0aa
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Add setup-networking role for multinode jobs

Multinode jobs need a mechanism for nodes to communicate to each
other so that they can support running a cloud with Neutron
networking.

Adding a setup-networking role that produces the same results as
the homonymous function in devstack-gate, and it includes most
of the code from the ovs-* roles in d-g.

Change-Id: I0f9381816ca775dd5ca0fb9153226f70201dd0aa

commit_message:
Remove nova list/get hosts scenarios

This patch is removing all the related nova list/get hosts commands. The
"hosts" subcommand was deprecated in Pike and now has been removed from
the CLI and Python binds at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532989/

Change-Id: I6c97400122f9c3826170fa8e421a9e9211f0bba8
Closes-Bug: #1753713

commit_message:
Log config options with oslo.config

This removes some custom Cinder code which
handles filtering secret config options in a flaky way.

Filtering will now be based on the "secret=True" option
flag.

Related-Bug: #1750074
Change-Id: I1c404b057d1471c85bd7eaf5c096f5912293460a
(cherry picked from commit 7d278042c5280e40d5ed68f504f45ef023f05e18)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 10:32:42.000000000', 'message': '[ci] Add py34 job for unittests

There are no much differences between py34 and py35, but since we claim
that we support python 34, we should launch at least unit tests against

Change-Id: Ie0c7d422178857129436fa14e4acaa82a58430fa
'}]
commit_message:
[ci] Add py34 job for unittests

There are no much differences between py34 and py35, but since we claim
that we support python 34, we should launch at least unit tests against
it.

Change-Id: Ie0c7d422178857129436fa14e4acaa82a58430fa

This is a soft -1. I think we do this for a reason, and attempting to fix this issue will simply re-open another one.

We need to investigate this more, IMO.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:17:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Ah-ha, good spot.  Hmm, should existing CI should've caught it?"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-03-01 11:44:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm wondering why does nova need to replug vifs when nova-compute restarts? If nova would not do that, this patch wouldn't be necessary IIUC."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-05 08:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would have not considered [0], the issue has been reported 4 years ago and does not provide enough information. Looked like happening under certain conditions and more related to an OVS issue where the version was not indicated.

Changing the nova-compute behavior to avoid replug vifs is out of the scope and should be considered as a long term view and after to have investigated all the impacts.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/33cc64fb817'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-05 10:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed that, 4 years ago, only 2 VIFs was active, ethernet and hybrid, for hybrid we never delete/create the ports in such circumstance [0], for ethernet we were doing that [1].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33cc64fb81773f0c246073d23c525357c9aa3b08/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L457
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33cc64fb81773f0c246073d23c525357c9aa3b08/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L422'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-05 13:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I checked with eng from OVS. It seems that back to 2.6 when OVS is running in kernel they fixed an issue to re-add to the datapath ports
that were in db but not in datapath which would have fixed the ofport id issue as-well. Then for vhu, when OVS is running in userspace it owns the devices so such ofport issue should not happen.

[0] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e21c6643a02c6b446d2fbdfde366ea303b4c2730'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-05 15:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> I checked with eng from OVS. It seems that back to 2.6 when OVS is
 > running in kernel they fixed an issue to re-add to the datapath
 > ports
 > that were in db but not in datapath which would have fixed the
 > ofport id issue as-well. Then for vhu, when OVS is running in
 > userspace it owns the devices so such ofport issue should not
 > happen.
 > 
 > [0] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e21c6643a02c6b446d2fbdfde366ea303b4c2730

Alright, I've validated this with the dpdkvhostuserclient interfaces and sahid (via a customer) has validated it with legacy dpdkvhostuser interfaces. It is not necessary to validate this with kernel interfaces as that code checks if the interface exists first. There do not appear to be any regressions and original bug appears to have been resolved in the above OVS change. As a result, I'm +2 on this."}, {'account_id': 7130, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks pretty straighforward patch ...'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

@pablo
yes i discussed this before the nova neutron cross project session on thursday. they were not able to confim that a bound port could never be converted to trunk port however they did confirm that this is not expected to work with the ovs-agent implementation and is not gurenteed by there api so they were ok with this change as it would not work today.

@sahid
as we discussed on irc i am happy to merge this on master.
if this is backported to ocata however we need to either a.) confirm that all major distros ship ovs 2.6 or b.) we need to add a check for the interfae type and only use --may-exists for dpdkvhostuser ports.
backports to queens+ will not need the check as all major distros ship a newer ovs.

i have already confirmed that rhel osp 11(ocata) ships ovs 2.6 https://redhatstackblog.redhat.com/2017/05/18/whats-new-red-hat-openstack-platform-11/ as does canonical http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu/dists/xenial-proposed/ocata/main/binary-amd64/Packages so in all likely hood the check will not be needed.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 3be52b9e650db643827b8b97b28799407f30926f'}]

commit_message:
Reload iptables instead of restart

Due to bz#1520534, restarting iptables may cause unrelated kernel
modules to be unloaded. In order to not trigger this condition we should
reload iptables from the configuration rather than restart the whole
process.

Change-Id: Ifc625eb51f6cc2a0a4cf4f83ac7a4978db641d75
Closes-Bug: #1752441
Closes-Bug: #1753492
(cherry picked from commit bb5013920ac658c99d9ae2ab7f81847b274aa177)

commit_message:
Use poll_for_events in undercloud install

The undercloud deploy command reimplemented poorly the poll_for_events
function, calling get_stack uselessly and resolving outputs. This fixes
it.

Change-Id: I9a1c64d5ee7336d9943aeb100f7dc4a6e4cc3402

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 11:04:08.000000000', 'message': 'Setup CA when >= queens

When >= queens ceilometer uses the identity-credentials relation
rather than the identity-service relation. When using HTTPS
ceilometer still needs the CA certificate from keystone.

This change sets up the CA when using the identity-credentials
relation.

Please merge https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/124 first.

Change-Id: I7c6ca1d913ad8b8123685a064933031f322869df
'}]
commit_message:
Setup CA when >= queens

When >= queens ceilometer uses the identity-credentials relation
rather than the identity-service relation. When using HTTPS
ceilometer still needs the CA certificate from keystone.

This change sets up the CA when using the identity-credentials
relation.

Please merge https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/124 first.

Change-Id: I7c6ca1d913ad8b8123685a064933031f322869df

commit_message:
Bump jinja2 minimum to 2.10 (required by Octavia)

Octavia will not function without newer features present in jinja2
version 2.10 and having >=2.8 in our requirements file is misleading.
This version is already installed due to upper-constraints, this would
just make it more explicit.

Change-Id: Ia1c1f7255be298f75e95be6230a099a7c54ad127
