commit_message:
[DNM] Workaround around a ceilometer installation issue.

[Mon Jan 15 15:15:04.203660 2018] [:error] [pid 20932]
           [remote 192.168.24.1:20] AttributeError: 'module' object has no
           attribute 'NotIn' > Mon Jan 15 15:15:04.203646 2018] [:error] [pid
           20932] [remote 192.168.24.1:20]     NotIDKey =
           voluptuous.All(six.text_type, voluptuous.NotIn(["id"])) >
           python-voluptuous

During

Exec[ceilo-gnocchi-upgrade]/returns: change from notrun to 0 failed:
       ceilometer-upgrade --skip-metering-database returned 1 instead of [0]

On the undercloud.

Seems to be solved in latest release.

Change-Id: I447f378908cd8eba8bfdf6c86ee1bfcdf85c6c29

[{'created': '2017-11-30 11:39:20.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Try adding delorean-current to the upgrade.

WIP: not sure about $CURRENT_RDO_MIRROR has the right substitution…

We can reach a state where we have a change in tripleo-heat-template
pike HEAD (called A) that depends on change on tripleo-common pike
HEAD (called B).

If a commit comes from tht past A, the depends-on to B is lost.  And,
if there hasn’t been any promotion then tripleo-common in delorean
won’t have the necessary code and we have systematic failure.

Using https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-pike/current for selected
packet would solves this.

Change-Id: I3db9dcc4c1db0ad0045789c3185903708564cac2

commit_message:
[WIP] Try adding delorean-current to the upgrade.

WIP: not sure about $CURRENT_RDO_MIRROR has the right substitution…

We can reach a state where we have a change in tripleo-heat-template
pike HEAD (called A) that depends on change on tripleo-common pike
HEAD (called B).

If a commit comes from tht past A, the depends-on to B is lost.  And,
if there hasn’t been any promotion then tripleo-common in delorean
won’t have the necessary code and we have systematic failure.

Using https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-pike/current for selected
packet would solves this.

Closes-Bug: #1735171
Change-Id: I3db9dcc4c1db0ad0045789c3185903708564cac2

Add the openstack overcloud upgrade command and workflow
for major upgrade from P to Queens.
It share the same code base as the minor upgrade but add options
for the converge part and take as parameter a list of
environment files, that could be needed in some cases for the
upgrade init stage. (like repo_setupt)

Change-Id: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f

commit_message:
Add major update implementation

Add the openstack overcloud upgrade command and workflow
for major upgrade from P to Queens.
It share the same code base as the minor upgrade but add options
for the converge part and take as parameter a list of
environment files, that could be needed in some cases for the
upgrade init stage. (like repo_setupt)

Change-Id: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f

[{'created': '2018-03-02 16:29:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix creation of port when network has admin's QoS policy set

In case when admin user creats QoS policy and will attach it to
user's namespace there was an issue with getting such QoS policy
with user's context to validate it.

This patch changes it, that QoS policy is always get with elevated
context during port/network create/update validation.

Change-Id: I464888ca3920b42edd6ab638f6a317ee51ef0994
Closes-Bug: #1750591
(cherry picked from commit 8c23e357095b986ddd966c2d280feb2eabb933bf)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix creation of port when network has admin's QoS policy set

In case when admin user creats QoS policy and will attach it to
user's namespace there was an issue with getting such QoS policy
with user's context to validate it.

This patch changes it, that QoS policy is always get with elevated
context during port/network create/update validation.

Change-Id: I464888ca3920b42edd6ab638f6a317ee51ef0994
Closes-Bug: #1750591
(cherry picked from commit 8c23e357095b986ddd966c2d280feb2eabb933bf)

commit_message:
Pass the queue_name to messaging_websocket function for update

For update and upgrade, we need to pass a different queue name
to the websocket in order to read the ansible runtime
This review allow to pass another queue than the tripleo default
one

Change-Id: I7166093cf1a26969425b33f4442f45fa8dc707f0

commit_message:
Use the ceph jewel repos from the openstack pike branch

Master, and in the future queens will use luminous, but pike's default
behavior is to use jewel.

Change-Id: I44ce112258e57ffc9e94504818ec28466630e17e
Closes-bug: 1752076

The role that sets up the user and its home folder must ensure that
the home folder is owned by stack as well.

commit_message:
Ignore ironic nodes when registering compute nodes

We don't want to upgrade ironic overcloud nodes so this change
filters them out from the overcloud hypervisors list.


Change-Id: I2ad47415a7f9b28a9a73c178fea79f5fcb689096
(cherry picked from commit ca132f8250ac9ebf2148944fe26435fac547204c )

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 10:25:18.000000000', 'message': "Configure heat DnsServers for undercloud install

The netconfig option dns_servers is defined from
DnsServers in t-h-t's net-config-undercloud.yaml.

Add missing configuration for the client as well, which
bounds nameservers defined in undercloud.conf's
undercloud_nameservers to the corresponding
DnsServers heat parameter.

Change-Id: I48d889e7a631682a221e2828fbc30a900562498f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Configure heat DnsServers for undercloud install

The netconfig option dns_servers is defined from
DnsServers in t-h-t's net-config-undercloud.yaml.

Add missing configuration for the client as well, which
bounds nameservers defined in undercloud.conf's
undercloud_nameservers to the corresponding
DnsServers heat parameter.

Change-Id: I48d889e7a631682a221e2828fbc30a900562498f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 16:03:57.000000000', 'message': 'cni health: Avoid capsh dependency

Procfs provides all we need to know and we avoid the
dependency on external tools.

In my testing, this takes 33µs (procfs) compared to
6.69ms (capsh).

Change-Id: I766ccaa3e80b0bde7375cef858547d2e43ad4e9f
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-03-05 16:51:15.000000000', 'message': 'cni health: Avoid capsh dependency

Procfs provides all we need to know and we avoid the
dependency on external tools.

In my testing, this takes 33µs (procfs) compared to
6.69ms (capsh).

Partially-Implements: blueprint cni-daemon-readiness-liveness
Change-Id: I766ccaa3e80b0bde7375cef858547d2e43ad4e9f
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
'}]
commit_message:
cni health: Avoid capsh dependency

Procfs provides all we need to know and we avoid the
dependency on external tools.

In my testing, this takes 33µs (procfs) compared to
6.69ms (capsh).

Partially-Implements: blueprint cni-daemon-readiness-liveness
Change-Id: I766ccaa3e80b0bde7375cef858547d2e43ad4e9f
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

make tests readable

using matchers makes the assertion more readable
also in case of an error it is more clear to see the
problem

subject: Support connecting gnocchi on internal endpoint
messages:
[{'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-17 06:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-17 15:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This option shouldn't be in ks_auth, as it is not directly related to keystone authentication. It should be in the gnocchi_collector and storage_gnocchi sections.

Also "ks_auth" should not be hardcoded: this name is specified in "auth_section" but could be anything'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Bhujay.

Thx for the patch. Is this feature a strong requirement for your use case ?
 
If no, we may prefer waiting for keystoneauth to support this feature: to any other reviewers, the discussion is open.

If yes, we will add this feature after you made the changes proposed by Luka.'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Luke and Maximie for your suggestion. Without this change cloudkitty processor fails  to connect to gnocchi in the internal url which is normal for any production setup . For my environment I have high dependency on this. Hence made the changes as Luke have suggested for submitted for your kind consideration'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-27 16:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This looks good to me. But could you please add the same option to the hybrid storage ? (cloudkitty/storage/hybrid/backends/gnocchi.py). Also, please fix the typo in the title of your commit message (intrenal -> internal).'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-27 17:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-27 17:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Luka for your guidance and suggestion. Made the changes as suggested'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-28 08:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

LGTM. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-28 08:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Sorry, I forgot something. The options need to be added to cloudkitty/common/config, in order to be documented when the config file is generated (cloudkitty.collector.gnocchi.end_point_type_opts)'}, {'account_id': 26181, 'date': '2018-02-28 15:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me, thanks! And sorry for the delay'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

LGTM. thx.'}]

commit_message:
Support connecting gnocchi on internal endpoint

currently interface type in ks_auth section of
cloudkitty.conf has no effect. gnocchi driver in
storage driver always tries connection to public
endpoint. This patch will enable connection as
per the interface type mentioned in conf file .

Change-Id: I1212b95f470b243342ff5face08ce17d26cfbe65
Closes-Bug: 1750095
Story: 2001558

commit_message:
doc: Fix manual installation neutron resource

With the addition of the services documentation, the creation of the pod
and services resources is much better explained there and the part in
manual only adds confusion. This patch refers users to the new
documentation

Change-Id: I1bd83011742d77b026c746253c543839eb05a4f0
Closes-Bug: #1711074
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

[{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Assuming all becomes well with the depends-on, big +1 on this.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@Doug:

Should I extend the commit message?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug,

In addition to what Andrey told:

- We worked a lot of years to make this split very smooth 
- End users would need just to change pip install rally to pip install rally-openstack and they will get the same expirience 
- There were few reasons why we are doing this split: 
-- Make core part of Rally lightweight, which simplifies and speeds up testing, reduce amount of requirements, simplify understanding of core part of Rally
-- Have separate releases for OpenStack Plugins & Core Part (more flexibility)
-- This allows to manage separately cores for openstack related plugins and for core rally 
-- Allows us to support more platforms (K8, Docker, ...), keeping them in separate repos with separate requirements with separate teams'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Doug,
 > 
 > In addition to what Andrey told:
 > 
 > - We worked a lot of years to make this split very smooth
 > - End users would need just to change pip install rally to pip
 > install rally-openstack and they will get the same expirience
 > - There were few reasons why we are doing this split:
 > -- Make core part of Rally lightweight, which simplifies and speeds
 > up testing, reduce amount of requirements, simplify understanding
 > of core part of Rally
 > -- Have separate releases for OpenStack Plugins & Core Part (more
 > flexibility)
 > -- This allows to manage separately cores for openstack related
 > plugins and for core rally
 > -- Allows us to support more platforms (K8, Docker, ...), keeping
 > them in separate repos with separate requirements with separate
 > teams

Like I said, I'm not in any way opposed to the idea of whatever you're doing, I just don't know what it is. What are "OpenStack plugins"? How do they relate to rally? What do they do? Are there other sorts of rally plugins that are not related to OpenStack?'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2018-02-19 23:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug, 

Let me try to answer on that question as well . 

Rally has basically 3 main components: Env, Task, Verify 

Env - is used to store/manage used platforms (OpenStack, K8, ....) most trivial case is just store credentials & other auth info, every platform has own plugin(s), you can use multiple platforms plugins in single Env 

Task - is component that is uses information from Env and execute test cases. Test cases are described in YAML (task spec), every test cases is composition of few different types of Task plugins (scenario, runner, context, sla, hooks) part of these plugins are common purpose (not specific to any of platform) like Runner, SLA, (some of hooks), however part of plugins requires specific platforms (e.g. OpenStack) for example scenario Nova.boot_and_delete_server, or Context users@openstack that creates openstack users and projects. 

Verify - is as well plugable thing that wraps unit test based frameworks (like Tempest) and provide nice tool on top of them 


So as you see there is core part of Rally (CLI, Framework, DB, Plugin Interfaces, Common purpose plugins) that will stay in main repo, and there are very OpenStack specific plugins that are going to go to separate repo. By the way even if you look today at the Rally repo OpenStack plugins are sot of separated  https://github.com/openstack/rally/tree/master/rally/plugins/openstack so there is not so much work to make to split them. 


I hope this clarifies more situation and what exactly we are doing.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-19 23:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:31:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any updates on this?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-03-05 22:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like there were no further questions posed after 2018-02-19, so according to https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/house-rules.html#other-project-team-updates it should have been eligible for approval as early as 2018-02-26. I exect PTG travel has simply delayed some approvals by the TC chair.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
Add roles into openstack-ansible deliverable

Molteniron, octavia, and Tacker are delivered by default with
OpenStack-Ansible. They follow the same delivery model, and should
therefore be included into the openstack-ansible deliverable,
instead of being independant.

This is in-line with our "aggregated release" vision.

Change-Id: I56940c1ad57d13408e3c708c12cb10dccccd84e7

subject: Add puppet-monasca to Puppet OpenStack
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 9414, 'name': 'zhongshengping', 'email': 'chdzsp@163.com', 'username': 'ZhongShengping'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Looks like puppet-monasca was imported in 2014 via I9250933bdc11f5a2b3478293318aa097ceb1b24d and was intended to be maintained by the puppet-openstack community from the outset. Is this governance addition correcting an oversight, or was there some mitigating circumstance preventing the team from claiming responsibility for it until recently?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It seems that no release for that Puppet package was ever done.  I went over all packages and found out that there was a few we never did releases to.

Once I released them (or proposed at least), the release checks failed due to the fact that they were not part of the governance.  I believe that it was simply something that was not done at the time because these modules are not frequently consumed.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-20 20:24:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

The reason why we didn't include puppet-monasca into Puppet OpenStack umbrella is because the module authors were working on their own, without following our code best practices and the module has no testing at all (very few unit tests).

Unless there is someone willing to maintain this module in our community (and its technical debt), I'm not willing to have this module part of our project."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-20 20:35:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote

I'll remove my negative vote and just abstain on this one. It's up to Mohammed to decide whether or not we support this module from now."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-20 22:29:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the history Emilien, you're much more familiar with it than me!

In my opinion, the module has not had any activity for over a year, but it has some basic unit testing and it doesn't seem to impact too much in our maintenance of modules.

If it starts becoming much more of a hassle, we can drop it, but until then, I don't mind keeping it around if (maybe) one day someone wants to pick it up."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-22 10:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-05 15:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-06 01:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Rollcall-Vote+1'}]

'}]

commit_message:
Update status of 'API deployed in uwsgi' goal

The Pike release of Glance contained a release note indicating
the Glance should not be deployed under uwsgi in production.  That
same advice is being given for Queens.  Add a note to the goal
completion section for that goal so that people who don't read the
release notes are aware of this.

Change-Id: Iab7310751874392c8cf787b6cd748aa55a7b7477

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 00:18:07.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iede00b810596718a4f71089a525f47a49649576b
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iede00b810596718a4f71089a525f47a49649576b

commit_message:

of the retirement process:

https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: Ice73c045abad2eef1790a62281979e16d4407250

@Sam. Without this patch, SIGHUP causes the service to restart. All this does, is have it reload the mutable config values.

I assumed that we wanted this behaviour with SIGHUP since that is what it is already doing. Bad assumption maybe. I guess we should find out what/if there is a consistent way of handling SIGHUP in openstack :-('}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-08-31 08:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

@Ruby, @Sam: Patch works fine. It reloads the configs without restarting the process. See http://paste.openstack.org/show/619997/

Note: I observed that process gets killed if its running in the background. It may be requirement that daemon process need to run in background for SIGHUP to work.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-08-31 08:58:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-14 19:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'SIGHUP restarts service with updated config values

This changes the ironic (ironic-api and ironic-conductor)
services so that when a SIGHUP signal is issued, the
service is restarted using any changed values for mutable
configuration options.

The mutable configuration options are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append
and are indicated as such in ironic.conf.sample, by
"# Note: This option can be changed without restarting.".

Change-Id: I0df46bb21dda035b25daad17737dbfedb861e868
Closes-Bug: #1585595

This changes the ironic (ironic-api and ironic-conductor)
services so that when a SIGHUP signal is issued, the
service reloads (and uses) the values of mutable configuration
options.

The mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts' mutable=True)
are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append
and are indicated as such in ironic's sample config
(https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/configuration/sample-config.html)
by "# Note: This option can be changed without restarting.".

Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's mutable=True
is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo method
mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying the
'restart_method=mutate' parameter, which this patch does.

Change-Id: I0df46bb21dda035b25daad17737dbfedb861e868

commit_message:
reloads mutable config values on SIGHUP

This changes the ironic (ironic-api and ironic-conductor)
services so that when a SIGHUP signal is issued, the
service reloads (and uses) the values of mutable configuration
options.

The mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts' mutable=True)
are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append
and are indicated as such in ironic's sample config
(https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/configuration/sample-config.html)
by "# Note: This option can be changed without restarting.".

Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's mutable=True
is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo method
mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying the
'restart_method=mutate' parameter, which this patch does.

Change-Id: I0df46bb21dda035b25daad17737dbfedb861e868
Closes-Bug: #1585595

commit_message:
Replace Nova hosts.list with services.list

'hosts' was removed from Nova client. Call instead Nova services.list
to query nova-compute services.

Change-Id: Ieea665141c7c9a151c51f9049f21516242e3bb1c

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Disk read/write should be an I/O bound operation, unlike compression which is CPU bound, so here Evenlet greenthreads should work fine.

Have you seen something different now that we are running compression on a native thread?'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If like you say this helps we should just make the whole backup and restore methods run on a native thread.'}, {'account_id': 14806, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The issue is seen with the latest code which has the changes for running compression on native thread,
Proposed changes are aligned to the fix which is made for bug 1692775,
I understand the file read/write is more I/o intensive that CPU, but considering the fact that we are using the Posix file system backup driver on the same system, repeated file read/write for huge file backup is leading is hitting more CPU cycles, which is causing the cinder backup service reporting down.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

OK, after digging a bit more the problem is that file I/O in many cases will block greenthreads.

Please proceed to move the whole backup creation process of the chunked driver to be on a native thread as discussed on IRC.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:15:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

- dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver http://52.42.67.99/16/518316/11/check/dsvm-veritas-access-cinder-driver/4ecf1b6 : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 47s'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

OK, I know that you are going to kill me (and not without reason)... But we have to go back to an implementation similar to the one you had earlier (although not exactly) where we had more calls to tpool.execute.

I've been doing some testing, and I've found that we have to be more careful than we thought when using tpool.execute, because it has a nasty bug [1] that will break our backup service.

The solution is to do the tpool.execute only on method calls that don't have any logging, so we need to do the tpool.execute at the "writer.write" code level and not at the "backup" or "_backup_chunk" level (since these have log calls).

I think we should mention it in the code comments so we don't end up changing it back before that is fixed in eventlet.


[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/432'}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2018-01-10 18:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> Hi,

 > patch. Have you met this problem? My version based on mitaka.

Sorry, the problem is that we can't DELETE the dest volume(Ceph backend) that restored by a backup."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 12:09:42.000000000', 'message': 'Run backup file read/write on native thread

During huge backup file read write operations holds the CPU which
leads to thread starvation, and cause cinder backup service to
report down, as DB operations are impacted.
Proposed changes are to run the file read/write operations on a
native thread.

Change-Id: I1f1d9c0d6e3f04f1ecd5ef7c5d813005ee116409
Closes-Bug: #1692775

native thread.

commit_message:
Run backup-restore operations on native thread

During huge backup file read write operations holds the CPU which
leads to thread starvation, and cause cinder backup service to
report down, as DB operations are impacted.
Proposed changes are to run CPU and file sensitive operations like
read, write, compress, decompress on a native thread.

Change-Id: I1f1d9c0d6e3f04f1ecd5ef7c5d813005ee116409
Closes-Bug: #1692775
Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>

The test problems are because it's trying to use the actual client in the tests. The find_resource_by_name/get_image_id/get_plugin_id functions in the SaharaClientPlugin are stubbed out in the tests. commit_message:
Fix sahara job type validation issue

Sahara Job Type api doesn't have 'get' function.
Heat sahara client should handle 'job_types' seperately.
And update the tests accordingly.

Closes-Bug: 1734421

Change-Id: Ia8a50cd964dd537a17f4b4c92835901e40d512a8

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6944369db46f6f9f5b96e131a95514f6750901fd

commit_message:
Change a parameter key for CIFS mounting command

While Huawei driver mounting CIFS filesystem, the username parameter
key passed to the mount command is by the form of "user=***", which's
compatible as "username=***" in Ubuntu. However, for some other
systems, such as Redhat, it is not valid.

This patch changes it to the more compatible form "username=***".

Change-Id: Ifa2ca7bcdceef2d47e2841a27ddf51d86f1ef63c
Closes-Bug: #1740816

commit_message:
Reload iptables instead of restart

Due to bz#1520534, restarting iptables may cause unrelated kernel
modules to be unloaded. In order to not trigger this condition we should
reload iptables from the configuration rather than restart the whole
process.

Change-Id: Ifc625eb51f6cc2a0a4cf4f83ac7a4978db641d75
Closes-Bug: #1752441
Closes-Bug: #1753492

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Since oslo.utils provide the ability to generate the uuid string,
and some others use oslo.utils[0] too. For consistency, this ps
replaces uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid().

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/qinling/blob/master/qinling/api/controllers/v1/types.py#L16

Change-Id: Iba01711dfadb36e2090926c2c7452ff62362b57b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 01:03:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make DB replicators ignore non-partition directories

If a cluster operator has some tooling that makes directories in
/srv/node/<disk>/accounts, then the account replicator will treat
those directories as partition dirs and may remove empty
subdirectories contained therein. This wastes time and confuses the
operator.

This commit makes DB replicators skip partition directories whose
names don't look like positive integers. This doesn't completely avoid
the problem since an operator can still use an all-digit name, but it
will skip directories like "tmp21945".

Change-Id: I8d6682915a555f537fc0ce8c39c3d52c99ff3056
'}]
commit_message:
Make DB replicators ignore non-partition directories

If a cluster operator has some tooling that makes directories in
/srv/node/<disk>/accounts, then the account replicator will treat
those directories as partition dirs and may remove empty
subdirectories contained therein. This wastes time and confuses the
operator.

This commit makes DB replicators skip partition directories whose
names don't look like positive integers. This doesn't completely avoid
the problem since an operator can still use an all-digit name, but it
will skip directories like "tmp21945".

Change-Id: I8d6682915a555f537fc0ce8c39c3d52c99ff3056

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-04 12:23:43.000000000', 'message': "WIP - uc/deploy: try to keep passwords from undercloud-passwords.conf

When upgrading a non-containerized undercloud to a containerized
undercloud, we would like to keep the same passwords that were used
before so our operators don't have to deal with new passwords and the
upgrade is more transparent.

This patch is doing the following:

- If undercloud-passwords.conf exists, undercloud-deploy will generate
  Heat parameters based on the existing passwords and override what was
  generated by the password workflow run by tripleo-common.
- We won't update undercloud-passwords.conf anymore, it was done by
  I1c60fd2f2732acb343a2f128258dbf0141ba0c82 but first of all the format
  was different (yaml vs ini) and also we don't need to update the file.
  Actually, we might remove the file in the future as it's only needed
  by instack-undercloud.

Closes-Bug: #1753063
Change-Id: Ib2d944c6ac7433461575ca6e9578e39404258b7b

commit_message:
uc/deploy: try to keep passwords from undercloud-passwords.conf

When upgrading a non-containerized undercloud to a containerized
undercloud, we would like to keep the same passwords that were used
before so our operators don't have to deal with new passwords and the
upgrade is more transparent.

This patch is doing the following:

If undercloud-passwords.conf exists, undercloud-deploy will generate
Heat parameters based on the existing passwords and override what was
generated by the password workflow run by tripleo-common.

Closes-Bug: #1753063
Change-Id: Ib2d944c6ac7433461575ca6e9578e39404258b7b
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 21:47:27.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Fix dvr_no_external agent restart with fips

Centralized floating IP return to Error state when
the 'dvr_no_external' agent restarts.
The sync data received from the server was not handling
the agent properly and so was not update the 'dvr_snat_bound'
flag.
This would initiate an floating IP Error state.
This patch will fix the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1741411
Change-Id: Id1cf26ffba8262ba7b3e5f41faa4cb28ba9dcb7d
(cherry picked from commit 477d4135ba079b0239a3e4f24c92ae3b7742e537)
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix dvr_no_external agent restart with fips

Centralized floating IP return to Error state when
the 'dvr_no_external' agent restarts.
The sync data received from the server was not handling
the agent properly and so was not update the 'dvr_snat_bound'
flag.
This would initiate an floating IP Error state.
This patch will fix the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1741411
Change-Id: Id1cf26ffba8262ba7b3e5f41faa4cb28ba9dcb7d
(cherry picked from commit 477d4135ba079b0239a3e4f24c92ae3b7742e537)

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying

commit_message:
DVR: verify subnet has gateway_ip before installing IPv4 flow

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying
to install the DVR IPv4 flow.  Do not install the flow
in this case since it is not required.

Change-Id: I79aba63498aa9af1156e37530627fcaec853a740
Closes-bug: #1728665
(cherry picked from commit 9be7b62f773d3f61da57c151bfbd5c8fe4d4e863)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 19:33:29.000000000', 'message': "Track cleave progress per db file rather than per node

Before, the last range cleaved and cleave context was tracked per node
index. If the actual db being tracked did not make it to the same node
index during a rebalance then the tracking metadata would be incorrect
and could lead to rows not being cleaved.

With this change the cleaving progress is tracked against the retiring
db hash and epoch.

The cleaving progress metadata is expanded to include a flag to
indicate when cleaving of a db has completed. This means that if
cleaving is completed but the unlink of the retiring db fails when
moving to sharded state then the cleaving will not be repeated. Before,
the completion of cleaving was deduced from the upper bound of the
last cleaved range being '', but this is potentially confused with
deleted sysmeta values which also take value ''.

This change means that the separate sharding context that was used to check
that a db had not changed between sharding starting and completing is
no longer required.

Change-Id: Ibb7bbb7f40b33001e9a56a8bf7fc235ac05b13dd
"}, {'created': '2018-03-05 19:38:36.000000000', 'message': "Track cleave progress per db file rather than per node

Before, the last range cleaved and cleave context was tracked per node
index. If the actual db being tracked did not make it to the same node
index during a rebalance then the tracking metadata would be incorrect
and could lead to rows not being cleaved.

With this change the cleaving progress is tracked against the retiring
db hash and epoch.

The cleaving progress metadata is expanded to include a flag to
indicate when cleaving of a db has completed. This means that if
cleaving is completed but the unlink of the retiring db fails when
moving to sharded state then the cleaving will not be repeated. Before,
the completion of cleaving was deduced from the upper bound of the
last cleaved range being '', but this is potentially confused with
deleted sysmeta values which also take value ''.

This change means that the separate sharding context that was used to check
that a db had not changed between sharding starting and completing is
no longer required.

Change-Id: Ibb7bbb7f40b33001e9a56a8bf7fc235ac05b13dd
"}]
commit_message:
Track cleave progress per db file rather than per node

Before, the last range cleaved and cleave context was tracked per node
index. If the actual db being tracked did not make it to the same node
index during a rebalance then the tracking metadata would be incorrect
and could lead to rows not being cleaved.

With this change the cleaving progress is tracked against the retiring
db hash and epoch.

The cleaving progress metadata is expanded to include a flag to
indicate when cleaving of a db has completed. This means that if
cleaving is completed but the unlink of the retiring db fails when
moving to sharded state then the cleaving will not be repeated. Before,
the completion of cleaving was deduced from the upper bound of the
last cleaved range being '', but this is potentially confused with
deleted sysmeta values which also take value ''.

This change means that the separate sharding context that was used to check
that a db had not changed between sharding starting and completing is
no longer required.

Change-Id: Ibb7bbb7f40b33001e9a56a8bf7fc235ac05b13dd

subject: Tolerate 404s during setUp/tearDown in func tests
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-01 23:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-03-02 14:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nsounds persuasive'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-03-06 01:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 23:43:50.000000000', 'message': "Tolerate 404s during setUp/tearDown in func tests

A couple times, I've seen tests fail in the gate because we got back a
404 while trying to clean out the test account. The story that gets us
here seems to be:

 - One or more object servers take too long to respond to the initial
   DELETE request, so the test client gets back a 503 and sleeps so
   it can retry.
 - Meanwhile, the servers finish writing their tombstones and want to
   respond 204 (but probably *actually* respond 408 because the proxy
   killed the connection).
 - The test client sends its retry, and since the object servers now
   have tombstones, it gets back a 404.

But the thing is, this is *outside of the test scope* anyway, we're just
trying to get back to a sane state. If it's gone, s much the better!

For an example of this, see the failures on patchset 3 of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534978 (which both failed for the same
reason on different tests).

Change-Id: I9ab2fd430d4800f9f55275959a20e30f09d9e1a4
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate 404s during setUp/tearDown in func tests

A couple times, I've seen tests fail in the gate because we got back a
404 while trying to clean out the test account. The story that gets us
here seems to be:

 - One or more object servers take too long to respond to the initial
   DELETE request, so the test client gets back a 503 and sleeps so
   it can retry.
 - Meanwhile, the servers finish writing their tombstones and want to
   respond 204 (but probably *actually* respond 408 because the proxy
   killed the connection).
 - The test client sends its retry, and since the object servers now
   have tombstones, it gets back a 404.

But the thing is, this is *outside of the test scope* anyway, we're just
trying to get back to a sane state. If it's gone, s much the better!

For an example of this, see the failures on patchset 3 of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534978 (which both failed for the same
reason on different tests).

Change-Id: I9ab2fd430d4800f9f55275959a20e30f09d9e1a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 20:15:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove references to hardcoded file writing in /tmp

/tmp is a world writeable directory, so using hardcoded filenames
in there is just a bad coding style (susceptible to symlink attacks).
Avoid using it to not give a bad precedent.

Change-Id: Ia66763a0e4714f2226e98dbd85600b2035bd5088
'}]
commit_message:
Remove references to hardcoded file writing in /tmp

/tmp is a world writeable directory, so using hardcoded filenames
in there is just a bad coding style (susceptible to symlink attacks).
Avoid using it to not give a bad precedent.

Change-Id: Ia66763a0e4714f2226e98dbd85600b2035bd5088

commit_message:
Check that overcloud_nodes is defined before assigning hostnames

overcloud_nodes is not used in baremetal (and OVB)
deployments by default. This review avoid the error when
overcloud_nodes is not defined.

Change-Id: I7b0c995cb325828abdb8e18e1b7d12863e8cd490

Adds network-list api to server side.

First, change the URL to 'images/<image>/search' which is the
correct URL to use. Second, change the HTTP method from 'SEARCH'
to 'GET' because 'GET' is the standard HTTP method.

Change-Id: I2bf054b16414f67954ac4eb973889fc0d488a260
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 01:34:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix image_search request

commit_message:
Fix image_search request

First, change the URL to 'images/<image>/search' which is the
correct URL to use. Second, change the HTTP method from 'SEARCH'
to 'GET' because 'GET' is the standard HTTP method.

Change-Id: I2bf054b16414f67954ac4eb973889fc0d488a260

commit_message:
Magnum: use endpoints section and lookups to set port

This PS moves magnum to use the endpoints section and lookups to
set the port it serves on.

commit_message:
Add docs for quota_class_set API

We have implemented quota-classes-show and quota-classes-update
api, but no api-ref is documented. This patch is to add api-ref
in the docs.

Change-Id: I275ee4fe048607a49368c4f985c055ab3a3bbfb6
Closes-bug: #1751683

environment variable.  Instead treat this the same way as os-image-name.

with OS_

Change-Id: Ib8c6f944eb2fe492bfc561f543d5b3cd030e9907

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ib8c6f944eb2fe492bfc561f543d5b3cd030e9907

At the same time we deprecate the old AGENT_NAME environment variable in

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ib8c6f944eb2fe492bfc561f543d5b3cd030e9907

commit_message:
Allow passing an agent-name as a command line argument

At the same time we deprecate the old AGENT_NAME environment variable in
favor of IRONIC_PYTHON_ARGENT_NAME.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ib8c6f944eb2fe492bfc561f543d5b3cd030e9907

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 07:01:57.000000000', 'message': "Increase size of Heat max_template_size

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat 'max_template_size' default value was 1M.
In instack-undercloud we bumped it to 2M, bug #1667697.
This change increases it to 4MB.

Change-Id: Ic913ecb44dac800131292d1f3661be5b71f35a78
Closes-Bug: 1752467
"}]
commit_message:
Increase size of Heat max_template_size

Most of the HTTP servers default max body size to 1MB, Apache, Nginx.
That default value is ok as long as users mostly get data from server
but when something needs to be uploaded, 1MB limit is often not enough.
This is what we see with Heat and some of the large templates.
It's not uncommon that WSGI apps have 10MB+ body size limit,
so with the current Heat default value we are still in low range sizes.

Original Heat 'max_template_size' default value was 1M.
In instack-undercloud we bumped it to 2M, bug #1667697.
This change increases it to 4MB.

Change-Id: Ic913ecb44dac800131292d1f3661be5b71f35a78
Closes-Bug: 1752467

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by
the logging code, rather than being done at the point
of the logging call.
See the oslo i18n guideline
* https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

'}]
commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by
the logging code, rather than being done at the point
of the logging call.
See the oslo i18n guideline
* https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
and
* https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/hacking/checks/other.py#L39
Closes-Bug: #1596829

Change-Id: Ibba5791669c137be1483805db657beb907030227

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 15:39:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add index on uuid column in cinder.reservation table

In
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/e271cd549d6cc1a331116a468edd6562b614b3fc/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L1399-L1408
We call SQL like:
select ... from cinder.reservations where reservation.uuid in ('xxx',
'yyy') for update;

As we don't have index on colume "uuid", so it locks all records in
reservation table.(with 5.6.22-71.0 Percona Server)
If we create volumes with multi threads, only one of them can execute
this SQL, even if these threads create volumes in different projects. The
performance is not good, because they must execute this SQL one by one.

This patch is to create index on column "uuid" to improve performance of
creating volume.

Change-Id: Ibd6110eed324caa95504ba38c1ed66a6e19a110a
Closes-bug: #1753476
'}]
commit_message:
Add index on uuid column in cinder.reservation table

In
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/e271cd549d6cc1a331116a468edd6562b614b3fc/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L1399-L1408
We call SQL like:
select ... from cinder.reservations where reservation.uuid in ('xxx',
'yyy') for update;

As we don't have index on colume "uuid", so it locks all records in
reservation table.(with 5.6.22-71.0 Percona Server)
If we create volumes with multi threads, only one of them can execute
this SQL, even if these threads create volumes in different projects. The
performance is not good, because they must execute this SQL one by one.

This patch is to create index on column "uuid" to improve performance of
creating volume.

Change-Id: Ibd6110eed324caa95504ba38c1ed66a6e19a110a
Closes-bug: #1753476

commit_message:
Add sidecar support for runtime

Split function package download functionality into a separate
container, so that it will be easy to add additional runtime support.

I was planning to use kubernetes new verion apps api in qinling, but
failed because the kubernetes client in global requirement is not
updated yet, so I comment the code out in case we use them in future.

Change-Id: I0709b8ac689638b78e00ca35d0fea2db6cae0d0f
Story: 2001580
Task: 6607

commit_message:
Complete schema of workload_stabilization strategy

This patch set completes schema by adding restrictions
to different types of schema properties.

It also makes workload_stabilization strategy more
user friendly by setting cpu_util as default metric.

Change-Id: If34cf4b7ee2f70dc9a86309cb94a90b19e3d9bec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 20:57:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception string format

The string %(action) is not valid, it misses the conversion specified,
add s for string.

Note that this leads to an untranslatable string, since our translation
tools check for valid formats and fail. In this case the failure comes
from a source code fail.

Change-Id: I2e630928dc32542a8a7c02657a9f0ab1eaab62ff
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception string format

The string %(action) is not valid, it misses the conversion specified,
add s for string.

Note that this leads to an untranslatable string, since our translation
tools check for valid formats and fail. In this case the failure comes
from a source code fail.

Change-Id: I2e630928dc32542a8a7c02657a9f0ab1eaab62ff

[{'created': '2018-03-05 09:56:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add ovs_extra netconfig for undercloud CI compat

Undercloud configured with heat installer uses
net-config-simple-bridge.yaml . In order to switch it to
net-config-undercloud.yaml and maintain features parity
of the latter with the former, add ovs_extra, which
takes defaults from new UndercloudOvsExtra param.

Additionally, clarify the difference for DnsServers vs
UndercloudNameserver use cases.

commit_message:
Add ovs_extra netconfig for undercloud CI compat

Undercloud configured with heat installer uses
net-config-simple-bridge.yaml . In order to switch it to
net-config-undercloud.yaml and maintain features parity
of the latter with the former, add the missing ovs_extra
data.

Change-Id: I1cf559416e8e48d61f320ee4d4299b4bdc3d6fb7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Fix broken validations on stack update
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-03-05 15:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-05 20:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 15:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942
(cherry picked from commit 8ceb4e2b78f8dd091faa73304db534bd87d21f45)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken validations on stack update

Patch I3be30ed8bb61d8ed514991a2f55c5c4e36c56411 fixed a confusing
message on initial deploy (bug #1703942) but broke stack update for
cases when there are no extra free nodes available (even though they
are not needed).

This patch reverts the earlier one and fixes the confusing message in
an alternative way -- we first validate available node count (a
validation for this already exists), and only if it succeeds we
proceed to validate the availability of nodes matching particular
flavors.

Change-Id: I91ddc03e5ac22494f5276f08f87011074483d5c6
Closes-Bug: #1745997
Related-Bug: #1703942
(cherry picked from commit 8ceb4e2b78f8dd091faa73304db534bd87d21f45)

messages: [{'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-28 14:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-05 20:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 14:51:12.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: verify subnet has gateway_ip before installing IPv4 flow

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying
to install the DVR IPv4 flow.  Do not install the flow
in this case since it is not required.

Change-Id: I79aba63498aa9af1156e37530627fcaec853a740
Closes-bug: #1728665
(cherry picked from commit 9be7b62f773d3f61da57c151bfbd5c8fe4d4e863)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: verify subnet has gateway_ip before installing IPv4 flow

If a user clears the gateway_ip of a subnet and the OVS
agent is re-started, it will throw an exception trying
to install the DVR IPv4 flow.  Do not install the flow
in this case since it is not required.

Change-Id: I79aba63498aa9af1156e37530627fcaec853a740
Closes-bug: #1728665
(cherry picked from commit 9be7b62f773d3f61da57c151bfbd5c8fe4d4e863)

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_apparmor: Relax the ping profile

We need to use the 'attach_disconnected' flag in the ping profile to fix
the following problem when using the overlayfs backend

[  773.853958] audit: type=1400 audit(1520265543.357:202): apparmor="DENIED" operation="getattr"
info="Failed name lookup - disconnected path"
error=-13 profile="/{usr/,}bin/ping" name="@/.snapshots/1/snapshot/var/lib/lxc/opensuse-42.3-amd64/rootfs/etc/ld.so.cache"
pid=9372 comm="ping" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=0 ouid=0

The 'attach_disconnected' flag needs to be used in order for paths
belonging to a different namespace to be attached to current root.

Closes-Bug: #1753454
Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1083980
Change-Id: Ied7632037f737c3f32c34dac70531065c54496c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 06:27:04.000000000', 'message': "Configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled.

For feature parity with the containerized undercloud, we will configure
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled, configure dhcp-match and
dhcp-option-force and the MTU by re-using NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu parameter.

The patch uses service_config_settings in ironic-conductor service, to
configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf and the Neutron DHCP Agent.
The reason of this way to do is because it'll be transparent for the
end-user when deploying a containerized Ironic + Neutron (which is what
we have on the undercloud as non-containerized).

In fact, the dnsmasq.conf was previously managed by instack-undercloud
and will now be managed by THT and used on the containerized-undercloud.

Depends-On: I58bc42c9a6cfe187d10eb2e882d8cc56496eca9b
Change-Id: I035cba7f88fda5adde816a32470fbbbad4da7d08
"}, {'created': '2018-02-20 07:21:42.000000000', 'message': "Configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled.

For feature parity with the containerized undercloud, we will configure
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled, configure dhcp-match and
dhcp-option-force and the MTU by re-using NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu parameter.

The patch uses service_config_settings in ironic-conductor service, to
configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf and the Neutron DHCP Agent.

end-user when deploying a containerized Ironic + Neutron (which is what
we have on the undercloud as non-containerized).

In fact, the dnsmasq.conf was previously managed by instack-undercloud
and will now be managed by THT and used on the containerized-undercloud.

Depends-On: I58bc42c9a6cfe187d10eb2e882d8cc56496eca9b
Change-Id: I035cba7f88fda5adde816a32470fbbbad4da7d08
"}]
commit_message:
Configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled.

For feature parity with the containerized undercloud, we will configure
/etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf when Ironic is enabled, configure dhcp-match and
dhcp-option-force and the MTU by re-using NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu parameter.

The patch uses service_config_settings in ironic-conductor service, to
configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf and the Neutron DHCP Agent.
The reason of this way to do is because it'll be transparent for the
end-user when deploying a containerized Ironic + Neutron (which is what
we have on the undercloud as non-containerized).

In fact, the dnsmasq.conf was previously managed by instack-undercloud
and will now be managed by THT and used on the containerized-undercloud.

Depends-On: I58bc42c9a6cfe187d10eb2e882d8cc56496eca9b
Change-Id: I035cba7f88fda5adde816a32470fbbbad4da7d08

commit_message:
Introduce neutron::dnsmasq

... that will configure /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf file, that can be used
by Neutron DHCP agent.
One use case it when deploying Ironic and when we want to enable ipxe
and configure specific MTU values, like we do in TripleO.

Change-Id: I07c8e3dc6926cf47915ec47d3f3e60b5d80b5f45

commit_message:
Add trusted option to apt mirrors

Since our Debian+Ubuntu mirrors are unsigned, we need to set the
"trusted" option on them in order to allow newer apt versions to pull
updates from them.

Test the change on base-test playbook first.

Change-Id: Ie20a68aa0a39163f1310ab3e22eaddcfb9704544
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/549162

commit_message:
Adds two profiles mellon and openidc for keystone. These modules are
required for keystone to support OpenID Connect and SAML auth.

Change-Id: I8b9a8563d2aeedb8d76b71ced0b7f1bf95744939
Implements: Adds required apache 2 modules for keystone external SSO
Closes-Bug: #1750679

commit_message:
Refactor lodash imports

This changes all lodash imports from the 'import * as _ from lodash' pattern to
using the 'import { ... } from 'lodash'' pattern.

This way our editors can have better autocompletion, and more importantly,
uglify can more effectively minify our code.

We recently got into the habit of using the new form.  This patch brings the
rest of the codebase up to that standard.

Change-Id: Idde3e1e44b53684a8880768c55777df54ad8b66a

commit_message:
Add support for libvirt VNC TLS

Configures certs/key for nova-novnc vencrypt when TLS is enabled on the
internal network. A dedicated IPA sub-CA can be used to restrict access,
however by default the main IPA CA is used.

Depends-On: Ic73bcbdbecc1bc05f43acdd5480370f37ead3fb8

commit_message:
Fix races in conditionals tests

In convergence, resources have a tendency to appear and disappear in their
own time, not atomically with a change to the stack state. Therefore when
testing conditionals (i.e. looking for resources to appear/disappear) we
must be careful to take into account the states of the resources we find to
avoid race conditions.

Change-Id: I488921c6c4c3324912ded494db5ab9605becce9b
Closes-Bug: #1737796

commit_message:
Remove self.__dict__ for formatting strings

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists.
It is not clear as using explicit dictionaries and help avoid some
errors during refactoring.

Change-Id: I06a2083a2635ed3103616de017331da158e330a3

commit_message:
use six.StringIO for compatibility with io.StringIO in python3

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO
which is a fake file object for textual data. It's an
alias for cStringIO.StringIO, in python2 and io.StringIO
in Python3

Change-Id: I1888fcd7971d69ccb612200154150300ed14c712

commit_message:
Move kernel to setup stage

Because we're pulling packages and services in stages in the undercloud,
we need to move the kernel profile to the setup stage for the dependant
patch.

Change-Id: I81ba7a493cf9a6ffd9ff7de91155be983b1ecdcb

commit_message:
Ensure sysctl values are configured early on

Docker will attempt to configure iptables rules if it finds that
ip_forward is not enabled prior to the docker daemon getting started.
Since we want this not to happen, we need to make sure the sysctl values
are configured early on in the deployment. Currently the kernel options
are still run via puppet on the host so we can leverage the puppet
spaceship operator to ensure that they sysctl values are configured
before any package installations which would occur priot to services
being started.

Depends-On: I81ba7a493cf9a6ffd9ff7de91155be983b1ecdcb
Change-Id: Id2ca4441b98dd2e8582adb21f2c06b9d23c7a299
Related-Bug: #1750194

A late change[0] in glance enabled the EMC actions as part of the
dbsync. This causes issues if the glance user does not have SUPER
permissions. This change temporarily enables SUPER permissions for
glance until a fix for this can be merged into glance.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: I84ce57a98f64367c83ac632cbf3c0c2b6c1cdba8

commit_message:
Temporarily add SUPER for glance user

A late change[0] in glance enabled the EMC actions as part of the
dbsync. This causes issues if the glance user does not have SUPER
permissions. This change temporarily enables SUPER permissions for
glance until a fix for this can be merged into glance.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Change-Id: I84ce57a98f64367c83ac632cbf3c0c2b6c1cdba8
Related-Bug: #1749641

commit_message:
Various improvements for rally-task-at-devstack job

* Move zuul configuration to .zuul.d directory. It allows to place job
  definitions into separate files (we have a lot of jobs).
* Copy `extra` files to the right folder
* Add check for rally results directory existance before fetching it
* Stop play if `rally task start` fails with unexpected error code
* Export RALLY_PLUGINS_DIR and RALLY_EXTRA_DIR environment variables
  before launching rally task, to provide backward compatibility.
  (see https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/rally-jobs/task-mistral.yaml#L1 )
* Save one line message about happened error
* Load custom plugins

Change-Id: I1004afb29b9c173e414c59ef54bf58458b5d9422
